description:
I couldnt even tell what kind of food they have here when my friend told me abuot this place. Turned out the food to be pretty good. One of the item we ordered, forgot its name already, gave us a whole pineapple. Definitely a little surprised. 

Would love to come back and check out more items on the menu in the future.
author: Susanne S.

description:
I've come here to dine in for lunch once and for MealPal twice. 

Dining in I was very underwhelmed. The service was a bit slow but the food is good. Huge big open spot, nothing to say wow over but good price and friendly but slow service. 


For MealPal I have ordered twice because I'm lazy and I want Thai food. Huge portion of rice and then small/medium portion of meat. If they made the portions more balanced I think it would be a winner. With that said the food is always delicious.  I just end up throwing out half the rice because it's more than any human being should eat.

Solid option for thai craving, spicy chicken and curry dishes are good.
author: Elizabeth J.

description:
This review is specifically for the Korad Duck Noodle Soup.

Ordered this on a whim because I was craving noodle soup and this was closest option. I've never heard of this dish before today so I don't know what I was expecting but it definitely was not worth the $15 I paid for it. Soup was bland, duck was hard and the greens barely existent so was very, very disappointed. Couldn't even eat half and ended up throwing it away :(
author: Hello E.

description:
To be precise - I give them a 3.5. Came here for lunch with my sister who works nearby. Upon entrance, it took a minute for anyone to even acknowledge us. It was probably the tail end of the lunch rush. Not a big deal to wait, just felt awkward as there was a bunch of people leaving and we had nowhere to go but stand by the entrance/podium. 

After we were seated, everything felt nice with the windows letting in a perfect amount of light. Service was fine, as I don't have any complaints. What it came down to was the food. The pad see ew was good - a very fair amount for the price and the flavor was good. The panang on the other hand was very disappointing. It wasn't sweet and the flavor was off, the tofu seemed a bit off..perhaps even a bit sour. 

I'm fairly forgiving so this could've just been an off day. I think I'd definitely get them another try.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Koh Samui & The Monkey is in the heart of SOMA, aka startup central of SF. We walked in at 12pm on a Tuesday, and were asked if we had a reservation. We did not, and were seated at a two top by the window pretty quickly. 

Food: We ordered the Panang curry with chicken instead of beef. A bowl of curry arrived with a side of rice. Tasted OK. Not spicy, and looked heavy on the coconut milk. The belly basil was a pork belly stir fry with Chinese broccoli. The pork belly had been previously deep fried, and then added to the stir fry. This was pretty tasty. Pork belly seldom disappoints. 

Service: It was the beginning of lunch, but as most tables were still filling up, it was still a bit slow for getting our order taken. Food took a little longer, but came out hot and fresh. Water needs to be requested, but staff were good at keeping them filled. 

Cost: The two entrees ran us about $27 after tax. 

Overall: They've also got a to-go area when you first enter the building if you want a quicker option.
author: Shirley B.

description: Came here on a weekday for lunch with coworkers. Menu was pretty pricey and food was extremely mediocre. I ordered the pad see ew, which  was bland and the portion was small. Won't be back...
author: Stephanie C.

description: Horrible Penang curry. No veggies, straight out of a can. Location and ambience is ok. Food came fast but this is nothing special mind you. More like an afterthought for the chef.
author: K C.

description:
I find curries very comforting. When deciding what to pick for our Friday office lunch, I realized I hadn't had Thai curry in a while. Decided to try Koh Samui & The Monkey. It arrived on April 14th around 12 noon via Forkable.

Green Curry Beef ($13): 
*Sliced beef with bamboo shoots, zucchini, basil, and bell pepper in green curry; served with jasmine rice
*Choice of Rice: sub Brown Rice (+$1)

I was a little delicate from the night before, so I really needed carbs! The brown rice was actually the best part of my meal. Perfectly cooked. Soft and chewy, but not mushy. The curry, however, was a little too thin for me. Almost watery. I love thicker curries, so this was a little disappointing. Almost like spooning soup on my rice. Not quite the sauciness I wanted. There was an average amount of meat and veggies (maybe even less than normal), but I think because the curry was so thin, it just seemed less substantial. It did have a nice flavor and they made it spicy, which I indicated on my order.

Loved the brown rice, but the star of my meal didn't really shine. If you like thin curries, this may be the spot for you. But I need my thick, saucy, comforting curry. 4 stars for the rice, but 2 for the curry. Averaging it out to 3 stars.
author: Elena N.

description:
Large spacious restaurant. However during my visit I notice most patrons order take out, and most apps offer online ordering. 

To order, as you enter, check off what you want to order, give to staff and take a seat. Food was good, had garlic ginger chicken. Good amounts protein.
author: Robin L.

description: The food here is ok, although rather small portions. The prices are at the upper range of mid-priced for San Francisco. The wait staff is always a bit cold, stand-offish and snooty. They have this new, very strange and even more distancing process where you circle your orders on a piece of paper before you sit down--like at a deli or something. It's weird. And it's another layer between you and your experience eating here. It's very close to where I work, and that's its main selling point for me--and I still don't go there very often.
author: Sprydle M.

description:
Pretty typical Thai food here at a slightly higher price. I ordered the Pad Thai with beef and I would say it was pretty typical. 

I also ordered the pot of gold appetizer which was pretty good. It's kind of like fried spring roll wrap with fish paste inside. Something new that I haven't tried before. 

For a group of 6 or more there is an 18% gratuity, which I wouldn't mind except the service was quite average.
author: Galen W.

description: disgraceful. food is bland and not as flavorful as much as it should be. Look at these pad see ew noodles. They're white. It should be golden brown, because they're supposed to be STIR FRIED NOODLES.
author: Jens Bryan F.

description:
The service is weird. I didn't realize that I had to take a menu and seat myself. Then nobody came to pick up the check so we paid ourselves at the counter. 

The food was okay for what it was. The catfish was too salty and the red curry was bland.
author: Rohan D.

description:
0 STARS if possible, this place is a joke!

I came here for lunch because I work right down the street in SOMA.  I arrived around 11:45 when there was no crowd, was seated right away and ordered my food.  20 minutes later, I receive an apology on the long wait because they had "an inspector" visiting.  I reasonably expected the food to come out of the kitchen, so I put my credit card on the table so I could pay once my food arrived.

Instead of receiving food, the waiter brings me the check and apologized for the wait. I told him I hadn't received any food yet, so I'm not paying for anything.  This is now 35 minutes later and I still haven't got food. He asked me if the food was ready was I actually going to eat it. I thought this was going to be a quick lunch but it turned out to be the biggest waste of time I've ever had in a restaurant.

I've had take-out here before but Koh Samui & The Monkey will never get a dime from me ever again.  Your restaurant service is garbage and the wait time is ridiculous for air.  I hope this place goes out of business from lackluster service and experience.
author: Jason T.

description:
It's not the only Thai restaurant in the neighborhood with a rice plate lunch special but extra props to Koh Samui & The Monkey for accepting credit cards too. 

They have a rotating weekday menu where you can get rice and 2 dishes for around $8-9. Slightly more than Ozone a couple of blocks away but I really appreciate that they take credit cards and trust you enough to walk away with your food to go next door into the dining room to pay with plastic. 

Pretty standard Thai fare like pad Thai, basil chicken, a variety of curries (meat and veggie), and other stir fry dishes. The one standout is something that is simply called "crispy chicken" and it is exactly what it's called. Crispy fried bits of chicken dressed in a sweet and spicy sauce. So yummy and addictive, I can eat it for days. 

For a quick grab and go lunch that is more substantial that a salad, Koh Samui & The Monkey does a good job of keeping things fresh daily with its rotating menu and decent servings.
author: Jon L.

description:
Koh Samui & The Monkey, hidden away in the SoMa district, is home to lots of delicious quality Thai food!

I come here every once in a while with coworkers as it's not too far from where I work and I enjoy the food here every time. Their appetizers are always a delight to have and I recommend the chicken satay, fried calamari, and crunchy puff in this area. They have some set meals for lunch which I believe come with a starter, entree, and drink for a good deal. Their pad thai and pad kee mao are very solid dishes, with their pad thai having a good amount of sweetness and the pad kee mao packing in quite the heat. There are also some interesting dishes here such as a seafood udon pad thai which was absolutely delicious and unique.

The service here is great and friendly. The seating and atmosphere is clean and nice for a casual meal. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for some delicious thai food in a comfortable sit down environment!
author: Joshua M.

description:
2.5 dinner

Not terribly impressed with our 4 person dinner of about 5 courses. Sauce more than anything substantive. Fish entree was small, but must say that was the tastiest thing I put in my mouth.

Tired, with no vibe to speak of the weeknight I patronized. But!!! We walked right past it and it was a no brainer after starters over at that Little skillet chicken drink place....

Could not recommend this establishment
author: Jana C.

description: WHYYYYYYYY? Why would you move the takeout counter into the restaurant? The only thing I like about this new setup: The lovely lady who runs it and the food is still good. But boy did you miss the mark with the new set up. The line is so long now and you know what everyone is doing while waiting? We are COMPLAINING about how much we hate the new set up. GO BACK if you know what's good for you. The only reason I'm coming back is because I love the takeout lady!
author: L. M.

description:
Ordered on Postmates and delivery time was crazy long.  A bit more than an hour?  It was ridiculous.  I got Tom Yum Kung Soup and Pad Kee Mow.  One of the two gave me really bad acid reflux, I think it was the noodles. 

I didn't enjoy the food, which is all I can vouch for.  I can't comment on the service or restaurant ambiance, but I definitely do not recommend going through Postmates.
author: Lyn C.

description:
My coworkers and I always make an effort to come here at least once a week. We usually say, "Hey what do you want?" and usually our response is "Well we haven't had Thai food this week." It is like a weekly tradition to come here.

I have tried a lot of things on the menu, some really good and some not so great. I have had the Fresh Spring Rolls (Po Sod). They come with shrimp, lettuce, mint leaves and noodles and served with peanut sauce. These are my favorite! I usually eat these as a meal also because they come with a good amount for one person. I also ordered the Green Papaya salad. It has shredded green papaya, prawns, cherry tomatoes and peanuts with a spicy lime dressing. This was really good also, but it is more of a side dish than a personal salad. It was so small that I was still hungry afterwards.

Now for the things that are not terrible, but didn't blow me away. At every Thai restaurant you have to try their Pad Thai. Their's comes with thin rice noodles with tofu, egg, bean sprouts and lime in a tamarind sauce. I thought it was good, but nothing special about it. I definitely have had better elsewhere. Also, my all time favorite Thai dish is Panang Curry, so I always have to try this too and compare which is my favorite. The Panang Curry Beef is stewed with kaffir leaves in panang curry. This was a little on the bland side for me. I am used to a lot of yummy rich curry flavor and then the freshness of the kaffir leaves, but this just was subpar.

This place is great for a quick lunch, dinner, or a big party. The servers are really nice and quick. I don't think my water was ever empty during lunch.
author: Theo T.

description:
Chanika is awesome. She is making me these fantastic drinks. I'm very happy. Food is good. I asked them for extra spicy. They make it close to authentic thai good. I would recommend crispy pork with Chinese broccoli very good. 

Plus for warriors fan they have TVs and big screen on! Loving it.
author: Fah Z.

description:
What a great lunch deal! Excellent atmosphere, food and price!

Appetizer, main dish + Thai drink (Thai Iced tea for me) ~$16.00!

I will come back here :-)
author: Richard L.

description:
Thai food is so ubiquitous in the Bay Area that I don't even consider it exotic food.  Out of all the Thai places frequented, this has to be my default place for a few reasons: close to where I live, fast delivery, and damn good Thai curries.  I order from here about every other week and am not surprised if I've tried just about everything on the menu.  I am sad they've phased out the soft shell crab or wok fried duck meat.

What I highly recommend: mango catfish curry, duck red curry, crisp pork belly, pumpkin curry, pineapple fried rice,vegetarian samosa, corn fritter, and shrimp papaya salad.

The ambiance is nice when I decide to dine in and service is always friendly and accommodating.  Had to knock it down a star because the price has risen over the years and kinda expensive when you could get decent Thai food easily in the City.  But that's SF inflation for you!
author: Bailey N.

description:
Thank you Katie B for suggesting our group of 8 head to Koh Samui & The Monkey for a spontaneous family style feast on a recent Thursday night... and thanks to KS&TM for accommodating our party on short notice.

We ordered a ton of food and our servers were great about helping us with suggestions on the right portions for the group.  Some of my favorite standout items were:

*Appetizers: 
-Fresh Spring Rolls
-Crunchy Puffs

*Salad:
-Green Papaya Salad

*Noodles:
-Bangkok Pad Thai Shrimp

*Entrees:
-Pumpkin Curry
-Basil Eggplant

*Sides:
-Stir Fried Green Beans
-Sticky Rice

And that's not all we ordered!  There were a few other dishes that we enjoyed as well, and there wasn't anything that was disappointing.

Service was attentive and friendly; our water was refilled as needed and those that ordered cocktails enjoyed those as well.  Some of the cocktails and drinks make for great photo opps too (ie: pineapples and coconuts).

This was definitely a memorable meal for me... filled with fun company and delicious food.  I'd absolutely return!
author: Gabi M.

description: We ordered here for lunch and was very disappointed by the quality of the food and portion. Their regular Tom yum soup comes in one size at the same price as anywhere else but portion is half the size. They also don't make it the traditional way with mushrooms. Instead you'll find cabbage and broccoli (my first time seeing that). I ordered pad see Yew and it was dry (almost white looking lacking in sauce). I also paid extra for beef but that was dry too. Most places charge for a seafood upgrade not a meat choice. Everyone else's portions and quality was subpar too. Unfortunately, we won't order here again since it was pricey.
author: Trinny T.

description:
Very quick so I would recommend this place for a work/business lunch. Casual atmosphere. The portions tend to be bigger than the normal lunch portion (biggest bang for your buck). 

You can't go wrong with the lunch special which is a 3 course meal with a drink for $15 dollars. There is an appetizer option (chicken satay, salad, etc.) and then the main course and then a choice of drink (always go with the thai ice tea).

Its a decent thai place in the city but nothing that blows you out of the water.
author: Kunal T.

description:
Kinda pricey for Thai food but standard pricing for the area. Everything I've gotten taste good. I've gotten pad see ew, pad Thai, panang curry, pad kee mao, larb gai (pretty spicy). My favorite thing to order seems like a seasonal item I forgot the name but it has egg noodles, with garlic honey pork. I would order that over and over. I've tried the spring rolls and they were so so probably wouldn't get those again. 

Service seems to be pretty good. I'd definitely come before 12 or after 1 to avoid the lunch rush. One time service was extremely slow and took forever to finish lunch. 

They do have a cool section of their restaurant for take out which I got a few times!
author: Jessica C.

description:
This place is iite. 
I got the Beef Mango Wok and the Honey Roasted Duck. Both dishes were not thaat good. They were just okay. You need to go with a really close friend like I did so that you focus on the conversation than the food. Service was excellent, however. Dont go if you want to eat good Thai food.
author: Kirsten K.

description: Thai food isn't as authentic and appetizing as other places in the city. Wouldn't come back even tho it's conveniently located in Soma.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
First off I have a business on Yelp and do not like giving bad reviews.

That said...

I'm still at this restaurant where I came to dinner. I had the Chicken Soup and the Crab Roll to start both great. Then I had a green shrimp and scallop curry and a side of eggplant both also tasty! 

I was halfway through the curry when my stomach started cramping and I started to throw up. I quickly asked the waiter where the bathroom was. I went in and threw up dinner. I came back out and told my waiter that I think I may have gotten a bad scallop. He walked away came back later with a scallop on a plate and said 'these are fine'. I said, "I am sure it is fine it may be possible I just got a really bad one, it happens."

He said well I'll take off half that dish. I said I am happy to pay for everything else but please take the entire dish off.  He argued saying he could not and I said what? "If you can talk half off you can take it all off!" He finally removed that single dish, no apology and instead said, "Our food does not agree with you, NEVER COME BACK!"

I am blown away at this treatment and of course will not come back but being treated like this is totally uncalled for. 

I am sure the food is normally good. Most of mine was as I said, but to speak to a customer like this is absurd! 

At hearing that, I paid my bill and left him zero tip. 

SO PISSED AT BEING TREATED LIKE THIS HERE! The server is named Tae.
author: Mark E. S.

description: Worst place in SF. No service at all. We've sit there for 10mins, no water, no order. And when we started to ask what's going on. The waiter told us to leave because we cannot wait. The place was not even packed, only 2 tables of people. Strongly not recommend this place.
author: Minghao L.

description:
I love Thai food and used to like Koh Samui and the Monkey before it went downhill. The food is mediocre.

The one thing I do enjoy is their Bags of Gold, so I just ordered from them via Grubhub. To my disgust, I found a long thick hair in one the "bags" as I was biting into it. I had to fish it out of my mouth because it was so long...

I called Koh Samui and was very polite (as I tend to be, I also don't usually write bad reviews) and to my surprise, the manager refused to refund this appetizer and could not care less. She did not offer any apology either and simply said, Call Grubhub.

I called Grubhub, and the customer service guy was great, apologized and said he would call Koh Samui. After trying to reason with them, he called back and said: "Wow, they don't seem to want to do anything about this. I'm so sorry!"

This was only a (long) hair and not a finger but I'm left with a bad taste in my mouth and will never order from them again!
author: Avi B.

description:
Meh, this place was okay. They have very dark lighting, but for some reason they seem to try too hard.. The food wasn't great, and pretty pricey. We also made reservations on opentable for a Saturday night, but when we got there it was EMPTY. There is really no need to make reservations imo. 

We ordered the Larb gai and pumpkin curry with rice. The larb is essentially a salad-type dish, with chicken, lime juice, and mint. It was way too salty though. I definitely had to drink lots of water while I ate this dish. It came out first, so we were basically just eating larb and water.. The pumpkin curry wasn't too hot either. The pumpkin wasn't even cooked well -- it was a bit tough, maybe not ripe? I'm not sure if we came on an off-day, or this place just isn't as good as it used to be. I hear their lunch specials are more worth the price, so I wouldn't mind trying that one of these days.
author: Connie L.

description:
We LOVE Koh Samui! We've lived in the neighborhood for six years now and always pop in. It's great for lunch and dinner, although they do close after lunch promptly at 2 pm so don't be late!

They've switched the menu up over the years,always adding new delicious dishes. I'm a huge fan of the pumpkin curry. I could eat that every day! If you like spiced food, they can totally go there! Full bar and all kinds of fun Monkey themed cocktails!! We just took friends, and they were impressed. We got there pretty late and they were nice about still feeding us:) Thanks guys!
author: Rachel L.

description:
Beef balls. 

Shrimp balls. 

Fish balls. 

Notice a theme here?!  

Too many balls to handle AND I only have two hands!  :p

The really cool thing about Koh Samui is that their happy hour menu is valid even on game days, because I found it incredibly difficult to find a happy hour spot near AT&T park when the Giants are in town. But, mission accomplished!

$5 appetizers and $5 cocktails (dark & stormy, strawberry mango margarita), we all went cheap except for the old man because it was his bday so he got Ketel One and cranberry, that was still affordable at $8! 

Awesome deals, I'll definitely be back and GO GIANTS!
author: Janice C.

description: I didn't get a Chance to try the food. After sitting 15 minutes we decided to leave. The hostess gave us our seats immediately but that was the only kind of costumer service we received. We left... I doubt they realized we had left.
author: Iliana C.

description:
Intending to head to Brickhouse Cafe for some relatively late night dinner, we were disappointed to find it closed. Hungry as we were, we saw the lights on across the street at Koh Samui, a Thai restaurant which we had wanted to come to for happy hour at some point. Unfortunately, this was not happy hour so we were stuck with the full dinner menu. 

I'll start by saying that some of the food was decent enough. The pad thai and fried rice dishes were above average as well. Sadly, the problem here was that the portions of meat and the proportional amount compared to vegetables was absolutely pathetic. This could possibly be forgiven if the prices weren't so damn high. Those two factors combined left us feeling not very impressed.

Overall, Koh Samui did not deliver the quality or quantity that its prices warranted. Thus, compared to other comparable Thai places, "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description: REALLY great Pad See Yoo. No need to make a reservation at lunch time, it doesn't get as crazy as dinner.
author: Julia O.

description: Nice THAI food. Their service isn't the best. Food taste good. Typical Thai food. Good size portions. The red curry was nice. The noodles the fat ones were good. They have a decent happy hour at the bar.
author: Cyrus D.

description:
Awesome Thai food. The peanut sauce wide rice noodles is dopeee as heck. It's pad-see ew... but with peanut sauce... and cucumbers! I lurv cucumbers. And peanut sauce is a nice changeup from the usual pad see-ew sauce.

On UberEATS!
author: B H.

description: I came here for lunch with co-workers one weekday and had a huge bento lunch box with chicken satay, yellow curry, rice, mango salad, and an Thai iced tea. All the food was delicious and the service was pretty quick even though the place was pretty packed. The prices were a bit high, but not outrageous. The menu is extensive and I definitely hope to come back and try more options.
author: Jeffrey S.

description: I was craving pad thai and so I decided to try this place. Pad thai is solid; although pricy compared to other places (ie in the Tenderloin area). They're very generous with the protein. It is not authentic, but it's good to eat if you're craving thai in the South Beach area.
author: Janet H.

description: I placed a to go order and was pretty shocked when I received my order. I ordered the pumpkin curry and the tom yung kung soup, $12 and $8. They were both in the same size container, about 12oz. For the price I paid, the portion size was ridiculously bad. Will never order from them again.
author: Gisele M.

description:
So my co-worker and I decided to order Tom Yum Kung soup ($8) and Pumpkin curry ($12) today.  We were both just flabbergasted and seriously disappointed when our order arrived.  Both the curry and soup came in pint sized containers .. and the containers were not even full at that!

The soup was meh and the curry was okay, a little sweet.  They charge moderate prices and are super cheap and mingy with serving size ... they could and should do better ... makes for a restaurant you should take a pass on ...
author: J C.

description:
Terrible restaurant.  Terrible food.  Not as advertised online.  Note: You will be charged for rice (that should be included in the entree).  Portions are super small and ambience not good. 
The food was salty and we told the meat was heated from frozen.   So not fresh either.  
DO NOT EAT HERE if you like yourself and your wallet.
author: Martin M.

description:
My bf and I were excited to try this place since we both love thai food and this is the closest thai restaurant we have. We both ordered pad see ew as it is one of our favorite dishes. Food portion was generous and the price was fair, but unfortunately we both agreed it was WAY too salty. Every bite got worse and worse. I think they put too much soy sauce. :(

Service was okay. Our waiter was really nice/friendly, but not very attentive. We worked hard to flag someone down more than once. I think we are open to trying again but specifically requesting for a lot less salt/soy sauce in our food. We'll see.
author: Sophia H.

description: Came here for lunch, thought it was great. They had some specials which comes with appetizers like imperial roll or shrimp rolls and then a main dish. I really liked the mango catfish dish. Not sure why it's rated this low as I really enjoyed the experience. Was also a pretty large place that didn't seem to be too busy since we had a large group. The shrimp rolls I thought were pretty solid, imperials were fine too.
author: Victor D.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city.  The wait staff is still really friendly and helpful.  The decor makes me feel like I'm in Thailand.

The quality of the presentation has gone down in recent years.  The pumpkin curry used to be served inside a kabocha squash.  Now it's a few pieces of squash in a small bowl.  

They also used to serve a tower of egg rolls.  The presentation was really nice, but now, it's literally 2-3 egg rolls cut at a diagonal.

Don't get me wrong, the food is still good, but the portion sizes have gone down, and the presentation isn't what it used to be.
author: Edward N.

description: Worst service ever. We made a reservation for 845 pm, and when we arrived they told us we had to order within 5 min because the kitchen closes at 900. We asked why we weren't told when we made the reservation, but got silence and blank stares in response. Then on top of that, as we walked out to figure out where to eat instead, they slammed the door in our face and put up a "now closed" sign!!!!
author: Diana H.

description: I've eaten at this restaurant 3 times. The first time was by fate craving Thai food and the others with my colleagues which were all fun get togethers. The food is really good. They have a lunch special too that's not bad on price too for being a Thai restaurant in the city. The only downside is that the food takes forever to make. Recommend coming early for lunch or dinner. It looks spacious but does get packed quick.
author: Stephanie J.

description:
Food is great and prices for portions is even better. 
Front door service is horrible. A blind man could do better. Wait staff ignores you for as long as they can. 

Came in after the lunch rush and took 15 minutes to be seated in a almost empty and clean place. Less ethnic guest where seated right away. By the time I was seated 4 others had been and those of us ethnic ones made five groups waiting. Waiters acknowledged all the non ethnic guests and the rest of us where finally allowed to order 20 min later. Food arrived quickly, but no mater how many times I asked for a water refill and others asked for ice tea refills they never came, even though the same waiter was refilling others water without those people asking. Hard not to be offended. 

If you have a little natural color to your skin avoid this place. If not the the decor is great and the food is better.
author: Richard P.

description:
Wow I wish I had read the Yelp reviews first to see how far this place has gone downhill. 

It was the most pathetically executed Thai food in the history of Thai food. 

Imperial Roll was served barely at room temperature. Food safety? Uncooked pork? Wow. Had to send it back and returned barely warmed. 

Red curry duck was sick. The duck at been roasted to death until it was as dry and leathery as a piece of jerky. 

Rice was not even edible. 

Forget this place.

Update: Downgrading to 1 star. Now I have diarrhea. Most likely from the uncooked pork in the uncooked imperial rolls. Or, perhaps from the duck that was sitting around for a decade or two.
author: Eater S.

description:
Pumpkin pork curry - really good, but expensive ($18????)
Fried calamari - horrible! Chewy (yes, I know calamari is chewy generally speaking, but this one is awful)
Saluted eggplant basil with beef - excellent!
Pad Thai chicken - the pad Thai is good, but the chicken in it is dry (likely OLD!)

This place used to be much better!
author: Ze N.

description:
I was really looking forward to trying this place but was quite disappointed.

The golden bags, were burnt.

The mango salad is nowhere as good as OSHA Thai.

The staff were friendly, but they didn't really seem to have their act together either.

I love the name of this place, but for me it didn't have much else going for it.
author: David T.

description: I've ordered several dishes from here including both fried noodle dishes and curries, and all of them have been pretty bland. I think there are much better Thai restaurants in this neighborhood.
author: Adam F.

description: The decor and ambiance place is very relaxed and pretty but I have pretty high standards for thai food since there are just so many options in the Bay Area. We ordered a glass of wine to go with our meal which complemented the food wonderfully. The Siracha Grilled Pork was delicious and the perfect combo of sweet and savory! The plating was very pretty and the rice came in a little bamboo container to keep it warm. The Koh Tao noodles with shrimp were delicious and cooked very well. The serving size was perfect and I left feeling full but not stuffed. The food is tasty but fairly average. It's a great date spot though due to the quiet ambiance with dim lighting!
author: Lisa H.

description:
For the management: the new happy hour menu, while classy and more substantial, is not why we all flocked here for so many years. We liked the simplicity, the affordability compared to similar soma pre-game institutions, the $3 drinks! Go back! Merge the old with the new! 

Yes, the food has improved. The drinks are about the same. Strong and delicious. But go back to the old faithful menu!
author: Mike V.

description: Went there tonight and was turned away; an hour before closing. Chef apparently didn't want to see e us. Avoid, and go to Basil Thai instead.
author: Russell S.

description: Good food , pleasant staff.. they had some deal on to-go if you get your own containers..
author: Anju J.

description: Last week was my second time here. I principally liked this place the first time because I found that th food was not oily at all, or at least less oily than other Thai places I tried. The curries are also very well balanced so you get to taste the spices and not have your head blown off with peppers and chillies. Both wine and food are reasonably priced so I can't really complain about it. We had Pad Thai and Panong Beef Curry and both of them were delicious, but the beef curry was the best of them! It was like a mix of pulled pork and light curry- so tender and juicy! They were short staffed that day so the bartender had to wait on us but that did not affect our dinner.
author: Paula C.

description:
It was my first time eating at Koh Samui & The Monkey, and I had an excellent experience. I got there at 2pm and didn't realize that they closed at 2:15pm to break between lunch and dinner. They were very hospitable and encouraged me to take my time enjoying my meal even though I had arrived right before they were closing. 

The food was delicious, the best Pad Thai that I've had in SF since moving here almost a year ago. I also loved the fact that they have a vegetarian crispy roll (just ask for it, it's not on the menu). The presentation was beautiful and they were happy to accommodate the fact that I'm vegetarian and wanted to add a vegetables and pineapple to the Pad Thai. They also didn't charge me for the addition, which was very nice.

Chad was my waiter and he provided some of the best service I've had in SF. Very knowledgeable, helpful, and attentive all while making me feel relaxed and encouraging me to stay as long as I was the last lunch-time patron. I've spent most of my life being a waitress so I am super appreciative of outstanding service - which is what I received from Chad. 

I work nearby and will most certainly be going back on a regular basis. I sincerely appreciate that they have so many vegetarian options and are willing to make substitutions/additions to order. Can't wait to try more of their menu! :-)
author: Love W.

description:
This place is one of the few solid restaurants within walking distance from my apartment, though it is slightly pricier than you could find at other Thai restaurants.

The first time I came here was on a date a couple years ago, but since moving out closer to Mission Bay, my roommates and I have ordered take out from here a couple times. On my most recent visit, I brought my family here for Mother's Day. The food is always consistently good. My favorite dish is always the pumpkin curry and this is one of the best I've had -- they include a lot of pumpkin (most places tend to skimp on it) and the spices are on point. Their coconut rice is also pretty good and not overly sweet.
author: Leana L.

description:
With the location, this should be the ideal place for a business lunch. It's not. 

A group of six showed up shortly after noon and service was dreadful. Forgotten/incorrect orders, several different servers, random food showing up at disorganized times. The main waitress even screwed up the bill. 

The food was overpriced for the quality and portion sizes.

I won't be back.
author: Kim C.

description:
Another one of those..."i rarely ever give one star" reviews.  I had high expectations for Koh Samui when i looked at their menu, looked inside, read reviews.  However, after trying this place there are only 3 things that came across my mind.

1. Flavors were not there
2. EXTREMELY expensive for thai food
3. People who think this place is great has never had great thai food before

I ordered the emerald curry and friend got the pumpkin.  Both curries came out luke warm, diluted, and shrimps uncooked.

So the horrible food + being way overpriced = 1 star.  I hate to be one of those people who knock down restaurants because their expensive but this place is an exception.  go anywhere else and you'll get better thai food.

Service was good though....
author: Vince L.

description:
The food here is mediocre, borderline bland. 

If you're coming here for a sit down lunch, definitely make reservations or else you'll have to wait. Service is also sloooowwwwww.

If you're looking for a quick to-go lunch, I'd recommend walking a few blocks over to Ozone for the same thing. It's a buck cheaper and a lot tastier. Portions are also much more generous over at Ozone.
author: Catherine C.

description:
There are only two Thai places within walking distance from my work near AT&T park. One is Ozone on 2nd, and the other is Koh Samui & The Monkey.

One thing is clear - both are pretty mediocre. The challenge is which mediocre Thai food you feel like that day. 

Koh Samui has a higher yelp rating than Ozone but I find Koh Samui worse. 

First of all, the prices are pretty high for mediocre food. I get it, we're in techie SoMa so everything is going to be a bit more expensive. But I expect a higher standard if you're going to up your prices. 

Second, the menu is a bit misleading. Our group of 6 all expected something different from the description in the menu. For instance, I ordered fried chicken with papaya salad expecting a breaded fried chicken but got a skinless "fried" chicken. My two friends ordered a pork stew with no "stew" but only pork with very little sauce. My other friend got a ginger honey pork with egg noodles, but this one actually came in a soup without him realizing it. 

Anyways, I've always known this place was mediocre but what broke me is the last (and final) time I visited. You see, we got in at 12pm and finally got our food at 1pm and the restaurant wasn't even busy. And all of our food didn't arrive at the same time. Three people got their food and the others had to wait for another 10~15 minutes which is my biggest pet peeve. Not only that, every table seated after us got served their food first and were out the door before our group. Our server started to bartend (?) and was not interested in our table for the most of the meal. We had to get up and track him down just to ask for the check. Now I don't expect crazy service at a casual restaurant but they seriously dropped the ball this time. 

Nothing at this restaurant is redeeming. I hate writing bad reviews but I strongly advise, avoid this spot.
author: Julie K.

description: I gave this restaurant a try because my friend Rosita recommended it. I went for the Pumpkin Curry, and it was delicious, probably because of the chunks of pumpkin. No need to say that it was incredibly tender and flavorful. The Mieng Kum (spinach leaves, chopped peanut, roasted coconut, lime, ginger, onion and chili) was recommended by the waitress and was great combination of flavors and spices. I left with mixed feelings about Koh Samui & The Monkey, I won't say I did not enjoy it but I can enjoy better Thai food in my local neighborhood restaurants.
author: Ruben M.

description:
I ordered pad Thai, grilled beef with salad and 2 Thai iced teas to go.  They told me it'll only take 10 minutes and it did. It didn't look like a busy night though. 

This is not the place to go to if you want authentic Thai food. The food was not bad, nor was it amazing. Pretty pricey for Thai food.
author: Rori G.

description:
Really good thai place!

Clean space, nice atmosphere, friendly staff, fairly casual. They try to stay out of your hair. A couple of us from the company went to eat lunch here and they were accommodating for a group of 10.

Last time I ordered the vegetable fried spring rolls and this time, they told me they were pre-made w/ pork..bizarre. Other than that, we had a good experience and obvi. thai iced tea is a MUST GET.
author: Sophie P.

description: The team at work today ordered from here and I had the Pad Thai. I was mentioning to everyone that I have not been able to find amazing Pad Thai anywhere to which everyone agreed. This however was probably the best I've had so far (to which everyone also agreed.) But it still wasn't wow. I've had "wow" Pad Thai before so I know it's out there. Also the tofu was a little crumbly and personally I only like very firm tofu so I wasn't thrilled with that. I'll order from here again if I'm craving Pad Thai in a pinch, but I'm still on the lookout.
author: Christopher J.

description: Koh Samui has gone downhill very far. I used to eat lunch or dinner here several times a month, but after a year away, it is clear the place needs a complete revamp. Lunch was terrible for both me and my companion: poorly wrapped, tasteless shrimp rolls, and bland curry with the proteins so overcooked they were as tough as shoe leather; the curry almost seemed as if it was left over from the day before. The same nice decor and warm staff as before, but the kitchen is now a disaster. I should have known something was changed when we walked in and what used to be a packed restaurant at lunchtime was half empty. Stay away - there are lots of better choices in the neighborhood.
author: tw s.

description: I love seafood padthai and grilled ribs from this place but it is pricer than most thai restaurants I have been to based on their portion size. :) Ordering delivery from this place is as simple as 1,2,3, fast service and friendly delivery people.
author: Claire Y.

description:
Happy Hour weekdays from 5-7p (I think) in the bar!
From time to time, we'll duck in to get some chicken pad thai off the happy hour bar menu. It's $7 and does the trick for my thai food cravings!
author: Leina K.

description:
10/4/13. Late Lunch

This restaurant is right across the street from my friend's work studio in SoMa. Given the convenience, and that she's got a short window for lunch we came here.

The restaurant is pretty cozy, with a partition separating the bar and the dining area. Statuettes of Buddhas are strewn everywhere. We were promptly seated by the window.

The lunch menu itself is ginormous, with over 25 items under noodles, rice plates and curry. They also have lunch box that includes two appetizers and a rice plate if a curry special. Lunch a la carts start at $10.

*Belly Basil ($14): stir-fried pork belly with the crispy ribs is an Asian comfort food (that means very ethnic). Served with chili peppers. A but greasy but hits the spot. 

*Spicy Basil Wok Fried Chicken ($10): otherwise known as Gai Ka Prow. Sautéed minced chicken very little, almost like two spoonfuls of grits, with bell peppers, basil, onions in a supposedly chili sauce. It's not spicy and in fact lacking flavor.

Both came with brown rice which was good. It's not mushy and smudged. But I have to say at the prices they charge, food is mediocre, especially the basil chicken, which is a standard Thai fare that is anywhere between $7 and $9 in this town and nobody should mess up.

Service is quite ready and they always filled our water. That said, I can still see thiss place as the convenient lunch spot which means, you don't have to go out of your way to eat here, with so many Thai restaurants in town.

P.S. They have a/c so on this rare 78F day it's pleasant dining here.
author: Matt Y.

description: I was pleasantly surprised to see them carry the Uinta Baba, a Utah beer. I had the pad Thai. Very well plated, and also the portion was wholesome. My friend and I had requested expedited service as we had to catch the  Caltrain within the next hour, which the staff provided very well. Thumbs up for the great food and service.
author: Naren V.

description:
Yum! 

My company offers a Buddy Lunch program where you can take new employees out to lunch when they first start. Koh Samui (what we've come to call "The Monkey Place") is one of the places we always fight over. Delicious but a bit pricey for lunch - so we try to take advantage when the company is paying. Hehe. 

They have lunch special options where you get:

- an appetizer (fresh spring rolls, fried egg rolls, or chicken skewers): I always go for the fresh spring rolls so I can't vouch for the other options but the spring rolls are delish and the peanut sauce is so yummy. I always sneak some onto my rice before they take it away. Lol
- a main course (usually various curries): The pumpkin curry is amazing. Creamy, flavorful, and not loaded with annoying oversized pumpkin chunks. 
- a drink (both alcoholic and non-alcoholic): I always go for the Thai iced tea. 

Oh and I can't recall if it's listed on the menu, but you also get a soup. The lunch specials range from $14.95 to I think $18.95 depending on the type of main course you want. 

Good tasty food and a good environment. Just some of the reasons why I always fight to book Buddy Lunch at Koh Samui before anyone else when newbies join.
author: Jennifer T.

description:
I could go on and on about how fabulous and great my experience here was....and it was truly a wonderful meal.  

However, I'll just make my review short and to the point:  Do order the pumpkin curry.  Really do save room and order it.  I was skeptical at first about this dish since never had I heard of such a concept of flavor.  Well, 
I was surprised how much I liked this dish, and it was easily the favorite of the evening.

Service was excellent.  My brother had called ahead for table and told them we'd be arriving in 10-15 minutes.  When we arrived, we had our
table waiting for us and someone was over to take our drink orders.  The server checked up on us periodically throughout the evening, making sure everything was ok, refilling our waters, and provided wonderful customer service overall.

Bottom Line:  I'll be back next visit to SF.
author: Michael C.

description:
I met up with my buddy and his girlfriend at a tech info session and when it was over, we were all pretty hungry.  Wanting to grab something in the neighborhood, we spotted Koh Samui across the street and the dream of some spicy and delicious Thai food entered our minds.  Unfortunately this would turn out to be a huge and costly mistake, one that would become a kitchen nightmare.

When our party of 4 was seated, we were delivered only 2 waters.  When asked over and over and over for another two, we were generally ignored until it came time to order.  I should have taken this as a bad sign, but the worst was yet to come.  We ordered the eggplant with tofu, duck salad, grilled chicken, and duck curry.  The eggplant and chicken arrived first, followed by the curry, but the salad was nowhere to be found.  After multiple inquiries to the waiter (who couldn't possibly have been more incompetent), I took up the issue with the two hostesses who couldn't care less.  I asked a total of 4 times when the dish would arrive and it wasn't until we had completed our meal that the salad hobbled in on our heels.  I turned the dish away and sent it back, and there was absolutely no apology from the waitstaff or hostesses whatsoever.  Not even a gesture of good will was offered at all.  Besides all that, I found the food bland, and the portion sizes were pathetic for the price.  Pedestrian dishes averaged between $15-20+ for basic entrees and had about half of the food we would have expected, leaving our table hungry and angry all at the same time.  Overrated, overpriced, and underwhelmed.

This is easily the worst Thai restaurant I have ever been to and there's not a chance in hell that I would ever give them another dime.  Service was worse than nonexistant and price were through the roof.  Koh Samui & The Monkey was insultingly bad in every possible way.

Food: 3/10

Service: 0/10

Price: $$

Atmosphere: 3/10
author: Joe M.

description:
Not sure why so many people had a problem with this place, then again, it was completely empty so the service couldn't have been bad. 

Ordered Bags of gold, Clay pot seabass & Emerald Curry. Eerything was very tasty, and the portions were satisfying. I would definitely make another trip to this place.
author: John R.

description:
Ordered catering from this restaurant for a group of 40-45 people and it was seamless. The woman on the phone was patient as I hastily did math, trying not to over or under order. When the delivery arrived, they helped arrange things and were patient as I calculated the tip. I asked to make a couple of dishes vegetarian, and I was pleased to see that everything was labeled very clearly. They made sure the vegetarian dishes weren't prepared with fish or oyster sauce. It may sound silly, but other places don't label their dishes for whatever reason...thank goodness for them.

I only ate the pad see ew, which was delicious. I ordered at the top of my budget and I ended up with just a little left over, so their serving suggestions were on the dot! My guests seemed pleased with the choices, considering everything but the thing I enjoyed was completely demolished. I think we were good on food, to say the least. I'd order from them again for another party!
author: Robbin A.

description:
Sat at the bar while waiting for the rest of my party and discovered their kick ass happy hour (only in the bar area) with $2.5 draft beer (among other adult offers)and $5 appetizers, 5-7pm every day. While the beer selection isn't extensive, it's definitely decent and the bartender was a swell guy.

When the rest of my party arrived we sat and immediately ordered the tofu spring rolls and spicy green beans to start. Both were delicious and fresh. Then came that gorgeous pumpkin curry (served a mini pumpkin), whose taste mirrored the presentation in every way. We also had some spicy chicken dish that had me crying like a school girl who just scraped her knee. Holy balls of fire it was hot, hot, hot.

The service was splendid and efficient and I love the bathroom signs.

SOMA, you done did it again! (Very vegetarian friendly!)
author: Katie B.

description:
The food here is good, or at least was good other times I've come.  However, tonight we couldn't eat here at all.  Contrary to what the Yelp listing says right now (June 3, 2016), this place is NOT open until 10:00.  We got there at 9:15, and it was closed.  In fact, so closed that two people who had arrived at the same time as us after having called in to-go orders (which they accepted) were locked out, same as us.

And really ... closing at 9:15 on a Friday night in San Francisco?  Ridiculous.
author: Lawrence S.

description: Good thai food with generous portions. Had the fresh spring rolls and the prawns cashew dish with rice.  The perfect amount of food for 2 people.  Service was also very friendly.  I'll definitely try other items and nabbed a to go menu on my way out.
author: Debbie L.

description: Definitely try the Tofu Mieng Khum - a snack to share where spinach leaves are covered in coconut flakes, roasted peanuts, ginger, tofu, and onion and topped with a sweet sauce. A fun plate to start out with.
author: Jai S.

description:
Met up with a friend for lunch who works nearby.  We were seated by one of the windows which gets a lot of sun & didn't help that I was wearing a black sweater.  He actually prefers Koh Samui over Osha Thai.  I didn't know what to get, so I stuck with chicken Pad Thai ($10).  He got the Pad Keo Mao with beef, which looked like chow fun..yummy!  My Pad Thai was pretty good and not overly greasy.    Service seemed spotty.  Portions were generous and prices were fair given the area as well.  

I heard that Koh Samui is also better than nearby Ozone, so check them out if you're craving Thai by the ballpark.  3ish.
author: Cat C.

description: Wanted to like it since the staff was efficient & nice, but my mango salad was loaded w/ red onions in addition to all the green onions already in the mix (I could stir fry another dish w/ that much onion!).  The taste was there in the mango salad (shredded coconut was a nice touch), but it seemed to be missing a few shrimps as it only has 3 half-shrimps in it which means it came w/ only 1 and 1/2 whole shrimps...sad.  Pad see mao was on the bland side.  Again, wanted to like it but prob skip.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
did not even know this place existed in soma until i was craving ethnic food and...the tenderloin was just a tad far on a monday evening. came with gf at 6:45 - just in time for one last round of happy hour prices - $3 beers on tap, $5 refreshing small cocktails! i had the strawberry margarita and it was yummly! there are also lots of bar bites at really amazing prices - but we were trying to eat healthy (relatively) and got the small pad thai for $7 (which turned out to be just right!).  also got the pumpkin curry and a side of coconut rice.  the pad thai was a bit too sweet for me, but really good if you put the curry on it.  curry was a good consistency and had many prawns, but a tad pricey at $17. oh welllls. 

overall cool spot for thai food in soma. definitely with a soma price tag though, so i would come back for their happy hour menu :)
author: Christina L.

description:
Came here for dinner last night and the ambience was lovely but the service fell short! Only one waiter for the entire restaurant so you can imagine how things went.

We ordered the bacon wrapped scallops which were uhmazing! Loved the sauce! And the grilled steak salad - pretty good.  Then it went downhill from there.  We ordered pork belly basil which turned out dry, tough, and lacking in flavor.  Looking down on our plates we felt we really couldn't eat it we sent it back and ordered something else.

We tried the Beef Mango which didn't turn out much better.  The vegetable presentation was the same so meat with peppers, carrots, the beef was tough and tasted like boiled beef and the sauce was just a sauce.

One glass of wine and three beers plus this unmemorable meal came up to $79 before tips.  So close to $100 I'd say was expensive for mediocre food.  OSHA Thai is a more reliable bet for tasty food. And better service!
author: Favoloso M.

description: Food is pretty good. We had the red curry and pad Thai both were great. But the service was only ok.
author: Sankara R.

description:
What I ate: Grilled lamb to die for, Pad thai with shrimp, Fire Cracker, Thai iced tea
Visit date: November 9, 2011
First time? Yes.

The food wasn't bad, it just wasn't that great, especially for the price. First of all, the lamb was definitely not to die for. The lamb was tender (a plus!), but was over seasoned (too salty!). It did, however, come with some nice veggies to cut the salt factor. The pad thai was slightly too al dente for my taste and the flavor wasn't too memorable. The Fire Cracker (mixed seafood, bell, onion, carrot, green bean and spicy peanut sauce) had a great sauce and the seafood was cooked well. This was my dish of choice among the three we tried. The Thai iced tea was too sweet (but that is the case for a lot of places); I simply diluted with water.

Overall, the food was probably at 3 stars, and at a 3-star level I would return to try other dishes, but because of the price tag I have to give this place a 2. The food is definitely not worth how much they charge. As far as coming back to this place... chances are I probably wouldn't unless someone was celebrating a birthday here.
author: Erin G.

description:
There was a bug in our food (I took a picture of it)

When we told the waiter, he said he'll let the manager know. When I asked to talk to the manger, the waiter said he just left.

Hmm...how convenient.
author: Emmie N.

description:
Koh Sumui has both an eat-in side and a take-away side. Being charged almost $5 for "a tea" in the eat-in side (and it wasn't good Thai tea, but some random up-marketed stuff) really put me off.

The take-away side, however, is worth a visit. (Although I find that Ozone, about one block away, has better portions and prices.) At Koh Samui the portions are somewhat dear, and even the take-away prices about $1 more than I expect, even when I know...

It's not that I didn't like the food, on either side, but I found the vibe was "take you for what you're worth, while you're still coming here" and there are better options very near-by.
author: Michael S.

description:
I've been here twice, and my accomplices have yet to try the Miracle Duck. Now, there are things in this world prefaced with the term "Miracle". There's Miracle Whip, the classic mayonnaise slash salad dressing slash but who actually uses it on salads and not as mayonnaise because we're no longer living in the 1930's. There's Miracle-Gro, the fertilizer that turns Venus Flytraps into man-eaters and returns Pluto Flytraps to legitimacy. Then there's Miracle Duck, the cooked Thai duck that upon being served rears its head at you, smiles and winks, gets up, flies around in a trail of sparkles, and after the meal goes to your house to clean your room and do your homework.

The stuff we have tried, however, is still pretty good. There are actually a number of things on the menu that I want to get to. In addition to the menus, they have an off-brand version of Highlights magazine for kids to read while you and your compatriots douse the sugar cubes for your absinthe - absinthe, in a Thai restaurant! - and dig into the meal. The servers are also nice, as is the 20-30 minute prep time ice cream & honeyed toast dessert we ordered just before closing. I see myself making repeat visits here. Some frabjous day one of us will get the duck.
author: Dan B.

description: I expected better tasting food - it seemed bland compared to other Thai restaurants I've been to.  Prices were also too high but the place is nice and clean.  They also have attentive staff.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: This is my favorite Thai place in San Francisco and I have been to Thailand many times.  The atmosphere is hip and trendy. The food is great!  Great.  Everything there is great.  The curries are good, the apps are delicious. The bar tenders are nice. The bar is great. What is not to love about this place?!!!
author: Elisa B.

description: I have been here twice and the food has been great. Ambience is pretty good too. The only down side is that there isn't much variety for vegetarians, although the veggie food they do have is delicious.
author: Bhumika A.

description:
First off, I didn't have high expectation on this restaurant since I was pretty hungry ard 9pm and most of the restaurant close early on Sunday night and this the nearest restaurant that opened at that time.

Thought it was a 2 dollar sign restaurant but turn out most of the entree price are above usd15 or more. So, we ordered pad Thai and Koh Tao.

Turn out it was pretty decent for a usd 11 and 14 entree. 

Will I visit again? Maybe.
author: Joline K.

description: Koh Samui is only 5 minutes from where I live so I eat here pretty often. From my many experiences, I would say it has the friendliest and most efficient service in the whole city. The food and wine is reasonably priced. It also has hands-down the best curries anywhere (pumpkin curry is to die for, and sirloin steak green curry is my weakness). One of my favorite restaurants anywhere.
author: Diego B.

description: We were table for four we ordered a salad which is a very good size. The service can  be a little bit slow The prices are reasonable. The imperial rolls were very tasty and seem right out of the fryer. Only bad item was the Asian beef. It came out rarer than rare and not very warm.  I will hold off ordering this dish.
author: Stefan N.

description:
I give this restaurant 5 stars because the food is amazing, the service is great and very friendly, the drinks are very yummy, the atmosphere very nice, cozy and cool. My friend and I had a drink called "French Kiss" and it was just perfect, very tasty. We ordered plenty of food, all amazing dishes: fried yellow corn for appetizer, noddles with tofu, pagnan beef, and cashew prawns. Omg, we ate sooo much, but it was great food!

I'm glad we ignored the bad yelp reviews. Kohn Samui and the Monkey is the best Thai restaurant I have ever tried.
author: Magoo M.

description:
The pumpkin curry here is the best!! The service was good albeit a little slower than I'd like. The pad thai was ok, only because it wasn't mixed together. The ribs are literally to die for, super  tender and very tasty. 

If the staff of this restaurant is reading this, I'm sorry I spilled my Thai Ice Tea on the way out. Thanks for being so nice about it.
author: Caroline C.

description:
My original plan was to go to Brickhouse Cafe across the street and then to Zeke's Sports Bar next door before heading to AT&T for ball game. Because Brickhouse Cafe had a long wait for 2 people, we went to Koh Samui since they had lots of space and it was happy hour. Their happy hour is amazing--lots of items to choose from and cheap drinks ($3 Singha beer). Because of this HH, I was surprised there weren't as many people here before the Giants game was starting.

We ordered these HH items:
1) pumpkin fries
2) pad thai
3) crispy chicken wings
4) crispy quail
5) thai chili margerita

Everything was delicious and each was ~$5 so my group of 4 people got a lot of drinks and food for a decent price. All the Thai decorations inside were nice and most of staff were authentic Thai people. Our server was Russian.
author: Marlon T.

description: This place is excellent! I don't know why is it under evaluated in Yelp. Pad Thai is not their strongest selling point but most other dishes are delicious. The monkey mummy signature dessert is also something that is unique.
author: Joyce C.

description:
So I had alligator meat before, but is this the BEST? No. San Diego still has me craving for their gator burger. The wild boar was chewy as well as the gator meat. I was expecting it to be more like lean meat like sauteed chicken breast for the gator meet. 

The papaya salad was eh, I had better, no spice at all, and had only two shrimp. You can taste the peanut in it though. I think they have better dishes, but I just didn't order those. Like the larb looked good as well as other curry and chicken dishes. 

Maybe I'll have better luck next time? I MAY come back..
author: Minerva L.

description: Rating for the lunch specials. I come here quite frequently for lunch. It's fast, delicious, and cheap. The common denominators for an afternoon oral pleasures. (Heheh) anyways, the lady behind the counter serves food in a box always with a smile on her face. Here's the catch, with all buffet style foods, come around 11:30, that's usually when it's fresh and hasn't been sitting under a heat lamp for hours. Otherwise, this might not be a place to go for a late lunch. It's not the best thai food, but it definitely satisfies the craving. $8.65 for two items and rice, a dollar less for one item. Clutch.
author: Elton F.

description: The chicken in my satay was raw. Raw chicken is as bad as it gets, especially on a Tuesday evening when the place wasn't crowded. What was worse was that it wasn't even taken off of the bill, even after I asked if they were really going to charge me for raw chicken. Not going back there.
author: Ramya A.

description:
Sometimes I walk around in a fog.  Take my recent visit to Koh Samui & the Monkey for example.  The popular Thai restaurant closes their lunch menu each day at 2:30 PM, but I just happened to completely ignore the posted hours when I walked into the restaurant closer to 2:45 PM.  I asked if I could still order lunch and surprisingly the friendly staff seated me.  It didn't even dawn on me that the restaurant might have been closed even as the table settings were being changed and the bar area was being swept and vacuumed.

I was handed an express lunch menu.  The Quick Set lunch allows one to select an appetizer from four available choices and a main entrée from another list of four choices served with jasmine rice.  I selected the Chicken Satay and the Spicy Roast Duck Curry.  Shortly after I ordered my server politely informed me that normal lunch hours end at 2:30 PM, but he insisted that it was okay and asked me not to rush with my meal.  As you might have guessed I felt pretty awkward at that moment.  As the menu implies the food is served very quickly.  I'm certain my late arrival had something to do with that too.

The Chicken Satay (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9Q8_UWUAf32TbnldHWonRw?select=Z89WJfBr1yfx9_B7L4fU-A) was two skewers of seasoned chicken breast meat grilled and topped with peanut sauce and served over a bed of shaved red cabbage with a pickled cucumber and red onion salad on the side.  Despite the hot temperature of the chicken I was definitely feeling guilty as I woofed down my appetizer quickly.  It was very good.

The Spicy Roast Duck Curry (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/9Q8_UWUAf32TbnldHWonRw?select=MQM_x4lDAnIvLKGyuHjeUg) was very good too.  It was maybe not quite as spicy as I would have preferred, but I managed to eat the entire serving with the rice and all.  The main entree had lots of boneless duck meat that had sunk to the bottom of the dish of mildly spicy curry sauce with chunks of red and green bell peppers, pineapple chunks and cherry tomatoes.  I enjoyed the selection very much and will order it again if it is available in a future visit.

When my server walked by to ask how I was doing and reiterated to me not to rush through my meal I just couldn't help but to eat it bit faster than I normally would.  I was in and out of the restaurant in less than 30 minutes.  Long story short, the food was very good and the service was impeccable.  Next time I'll be certain to visit well before 2:30 PM to enjoy their lunch menu more properly.

Thanks to the staff at Koh Samui & the Monkey for seating me and offering me such fabulous service when other restaurants might have asked me to leave!
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
It's around the corner from my office and I'm there all the time. I must say that I do really enjoy it. 

If I'm not sharing, the pad see ew's my favorite.
author: Dimple B.

description:
They have a extensive selection and most dishes are done really well. 

Pros: the pumpkin curry have good flavor, vegetable stir-fry is light and flavorful. 
Pad Thai here is one of my favorite in the city. They also have TV by the bar if you want to catch a game.

Cons: for the clay pot dish, the sea bass was overdone and dry, yuck! Their food is a bit high, although they do have happy hr at the bar if want to be frugal.

Overall, this is my go-to neighborhood Thai place. Food is consistent, and perfect place for late nights or dessert or if you are craving Thai curry or pad Thai.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
This is not a destination restaurant. The pad thai, curries, and appetizers here are all fine, nothing spectacular, but easy to get a table, and service is pretty decent and quick. 

The last time we were here for dinner, it felt like the waitstaff was trying to push certain appetizers and alcoholic drinks and was a little too sales-y. 

My vegetarian husband said this place seems a lot less veggie-friendly than the typical Thai restaurant in the Bay Area.

I've eaten here a couple times and will eat here again because it's conveniently located in an neighborhood where dining options are pretty sparse during non-workday hours.
author: Elaine S.

description:
We ordered delivery from Koh Samui & The Monkey with little foreknowledge of the restaurant's quality. What a gem! The food was fantastic and he delivery time was reasonable. 

We ordered the Emerald Curry and the Kee Mao Scallops Noodles. Both were tasty. More surprising was how well the dishes survived the delivery lag.  The scallops were succulent, he shrimp tender, and the temperature was spot on. I will eagerly order delivery from KS&TM again. 

Oh, and order the coconut rice. You won't regret it.
author: Rob B.

description:
My all-time-favorite Thai food is green curry. So, like it or not, I judge a Thai restaurant based on the green curry. And Koh Samui's green curry is mediocre.

Missing was the spiciness, the sweetness, and tangy-ness normally associated with a green curry. The flavors were there, but toned way down. On top of that, the green and red peppers were barely cooked and were super crispy.

I also tried some of my friend's pumpkin curry, and all of the flavors were turned down to zero. I'm not sure how this is one of the most popular items, but I guess being the most popular item at a bad restaurant doesn't really mean much. zing!
author: Nadeem A.

description: I've eaten in once before, and ordered for delivery today. The food was okay, but very over-priced and the delivery was slow. I got four pieces of pork for $17 and an-hour long delivery. I'm not in a good mood right now...
author: Cissy M.

description:
Koh Samui & The Monkey, lovingly referred to as "Monkey Thai", by my coworkers and myself, has become one of our favorite lunch spots. 

They have a great lunch special. For $14.95 you can get an appetizer, a main dish, wish a side of rice, and a beer or Thai iced tea.

I have tried the green curry, the yellow curry, and the chicken satay and egg roll appetizers. My favorite being the yellow curry, it is super creamy and loaded with potatoes and chicken. The chicken satay is also really good, covered in peanut sauce and served with a small cucumber salad. 

I have been to "Monkey Thai" for dinner one time. I ordered the Thai steak salad. It was a HUGE portion of steak, and it was perfectly seasoned, and the dressing on the salad was incredible.  

I recommend getting here a little early or making a reservation as they get really busy at lunch time!
author: Stephanie T.

description: just terrible. used to be amazing..ravioli was undercooked. same with the pumpkin in the curry. shame.
author: Salim M.

description:
Pumpkin Curry, Seabass with glass noodles, chicken satay, volcano fried rice - all my favorites here. The food is always good, service is good, and cocktails are great!! 

It's a little pricey, but worth it for a fun night out.
author: Jon H.

description: The vegan options smell like fish oil. I would not go here if you're strict vegan or vegetarian.
author: ashwin n.

description:
Koh Samui caters to the upper-middle class American with a stereotypical white person palette.  Why?

1) Thai iced tea is way too sweet!  I may as well drink the can of sweetened condensed milk alone!
2) Peanut sauce that accompanies the spring rolls is way too sweet!  Not to mention it was served separated, as you would find in a failed emulsion -- a peanutty paste on top, a grossly sweet sauce underneath that was reminiscent of that orange-colored sweet sauce at Chinese restaurants for dipping those fried wonton strips into.
3) Ambiance: the dining room is pretty nice looking and clean.  We all know Asians don't care about ambiance...
4) Portion size: small!  My curry came in a square bowl that is similar in size to a standard rice bowl.  Really??!  That pathetic portion of curry + rice costs $11.50??!

And the worst part: My pumpkin and chicken red curry ($11.50) had 2 cubes of pumpkin in it.  Yes, 2.  Is that really enough to constitute a pumpkin curry??  Perhaps I should mention that the chicken red curry costs $9.50, so does this mean that each cube of pumpkin costs $1?!  To make matters even worse, the chicken was overcooked and tough.  It's really too bad, because I actually liked the flavor of the red curry.  I just wish they put in more of the advertised pumpkin and didn't overcook the chicken.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
I can't remember the last time I left a restaurant so completely satisfied and happy!

For an appetizer we had the Bags of Gold and spare ribs. I can't recommend both of those enough! The ribs were fall off the bone yummy! 

Our entrées were the beef curry and cashew prawns. The prawns were spicy but deliciously flavored,  certainly not good for those who dislike spice! The beef curry was amazing, too.

Service is fine, cocktails are fantastic, and overall, it was a great dining experience. I definitely will eat here again.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Ordered here using Amazon Prime. Found that the Amazon Prime prices are inflated. Eat24 had Pad Thai for $10, we paid $13. Prawn Cashew Nuts $18 versus $16, and even at $16 it would be a huge disappointment for a very small amount of food. The Pad Thai was not traditional. Maybe it's traditional some parts of Bangkok, but definitely not like the ones we had (actually in Bangkok).

I don't know who to blame for the markup, whether it's Amazon or the restaurant, but the food and value doesn't merit more than 2 stars.
author: O W.

description: Most things were pretty good. I wouldn't get the soft shell crab - too fried for us.
author: Neil Z.

description:
I have never had a bad meal at Koh Samui & The Monkey.  This particular evening continued that streak.  Wanting to have a quiet, enjoyable meal before watching the Smuin Christmas Ballet, we originally had reservations for 5 p.m.; however, we had to make a last-minute delay until 5:15 and the restaurant accommodated us without a fuss.

We dined on four dishes:  green papaya salad, shrimp spring rolls, pumpkin curry, and seabass.  All the dishes were excellent and they accommodated our need to be finished by 6:30 p.m. in order to make it to our show.

Service was prompt and friendly, and the wines (by the glass) were quite good!  Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.

Cheers to the staff for an enjoyable, delectable meal!

I'll be back!
author: Alex S.

description:
This was a cool surprise - a really great happy hour special!

I was here on a Friday night and enjoyed a very good happy hour of drinks and food at a very reasonable price.  We started off the meal with a couple of cocktails with Thai liqueur, which were good.  We also shared Pad Thai and Bangkok BBQ Chicken - everything was pretty good.  All in all, we had two drinks and two decent portions of plates for about $15 - that's really good.

While the food isn't the best Thai food in the city, it's still pretty good.  Considering the price-point during happy hour, it's great.
author: Ken G.

description:
Really yummy! i had fresh coconut juice as I waited for my friends to convene. 

The bartender was really nice, and the coconut juice was exquisite! It's huge, an actual coconut, and you're given two straws and a spoon to scoop coconut out - delish!
author: Raji R.

description: Having been to Koh Samui three times and met the Monkey back in 1989, this place is great to visit, enjoy the food and reminisce.  They have both dine in and take out, but the take out is a separate counter near the front door which is unusual.  Love the local Thai style food and a great place to grab a casual business lunch.
author: H. H.

description:
We made same day reservations for a Saturday night at 5:15pm Because this area is near the ballpark, metered parking on a Saturday night until 10pm!!!! Ok back to my review. For starters we ordered the pork spare ribs, fried sweet corn fritters, chicken mieng kum and a cup of tom yum kung soup.  Everything was served hot which was nice, except the mieng kum which is a cold dish. The pork spare ribs ( 4-5 avg sized ribs) had a little kick to them, luckily our daughter still ate it with her side of steamed rice. She's 4 1/2 years old. The corn fritters ( 6 pieces)  had a crisp to them on the outside and then soft on the inside which I did not expect. Not bad, but different. The mieng kum ( 6 spinach leave sizes)  was new for us and that tasted really good and refreshing. The server instructed us on how to eat it and pretty yummy. Lastly the cup of tom yum kung soup came and 3 prawns were included in it. Very flavorful. 

By this time we were pretty content. Although we still had 2 dishes coming. We had the shrimp pad thai and the Sri Ra Char Grilled Pork. The Pad Thai had was served with maybe 6 pieces of shrimp or more which was nice, although the noodles seemed a bit undercooked or stiff. Not as soft and lacked the kick I usually taste..maybe it could have used a little more fish sauce or rice vinegar? I'm not sure..but something... and the Grilled Pork was plentiful but it seemed more like it was panned fried vs. grilled? It came with sticky rice and some pickled cucumbers w/ mangos on the side which was a nice touch. 

Would we come back, maybe...although it was pricey although we did order a lot for just 2 1/2 people.  Service I would say was pretty good. Everything came out hot and fresh. You might think service may be slow, but it was fine for us... It enabled us to enjoy our dishes and digest and be ready for the next dish. 

Before I forget..one thing I did notice was that the chairs you sit on are very heavy so if you have a child, I don't think you have to worry about your chair tipping over. LOL
author: Carolyn S.

description:
Ever since I've moved to San Francisco, I have always wanted to have dinner at Koh Samui & The Monkey. This neighborhood gem is located in the SOMA district and has a notorious reputation for having the best Thai food in San Francisco. I'm surprised it is not known as one of the most romantic restaurants in San Francisco. With it's dim lighting and romantic ambiance it definitely fits the description.

Between a party of three, we ordered 5 dishes: Shrimp Pad Thai, Pumpkin Curry, Mango Catfish, Crispy Soft Shell Crab and the Grilled Lamb to die for. My favorite dishes were the Pumpkin Curry and the Shrimp Pad Thai. You can always tell if a Thai restaurant is amazing by how delicious their Pad Thai dish is!

My only disappointment was that my Pumpkin Curry came in bowl instead of an actual pumpkin. However, it was a delicious meal nonetheless! If I lived closer to the SOMA district, I would definitely be a frequent diner.
author: Viennelyn C.

description:
Got Tom Kha Gai (soup) here. Tasted weird. We send it back. Waiter later informed us that some ingredients were missing. The rest of the food was ok. I kinda liked "Madame Sea Bass", though it was a bit low on spices.

Waiter tried to memorize our order but ended up forgetting our Fried Rice.
author: Tito T.

description: Decent Thai spot. Food quality looked good, just nothing that really impressed me. On my one visit, what stood out was the no so great service. When we first sat down we were told they were out of Thai Iced Tea, at 11:30am! How does a Thai restaurant run out of that?! I ordered some other tea that luckily never arrived. I say luckily because 15 minutes later I spot another table getting served Thai Iced Tea. I ask the waitress if they have it back in stock and she gives me a little attitude but brings me one.
