Five minutes later we asked  another server if we could speak to the manager. This because our server refused to make eye contact or come to our table. We waited a few more minutes and witnessed what seemed to be an animated discussion about our situation at the back of the restaurant.  We left before we could find out the result.  Now enjoying dinner at Fringale where there is wonderful service and food.
author: Lauren N.

description: This is one of my favorite places to get thai in the city.  The pork belly basil is one of my favorites but almost everything here is great.  I try to order them at least once a month for catering at work.  Love the pork hocks too.  YUMMM!!!
author: Erika S.

description:
My high school friends and I used to be mature and sophisticated enough to eat at nicer, upscale restaurants like this, but our experience here shows maybe she wouldn't go out in public too often. Just kidding, but we couldn't stop laughing and cracking up, probably disturbing dinner for many couples. 

Things to know: The place is pretty small, there are a couple of waiters/waitresses that wait on the whole place (but are really fast), and the food is pretty good. The decor is really nice, and the restaurant is on the 2nd floor. 

But don't come here with a nearly empty wallet. Their portions aren't family style like other thai restaurants--but much smaller. And more expensive. It's $6 for 1 cup of tom yum soup. at other places it's like $8 for a pot of soup to share. Their main dishes are good though, and they are pretty decently priced. 

They have a $10 cake cutting fee!!

I still don't know who Koh Samui or The Monkey are. I thought I would figure it out during my visit.
author: Shreya G.

description:
Location, location, location.  If it weren't conveniently located in the heart of SOMA, I doubt it'd have attracted as large of a lunch crowd (never had dinner there, so I can't say, which just goes to prove my point).  

Their noodle soups are a complete disappointment.  Play it safe and stick to the rice plates or lunch boxes.  The portions are reasonable - but don't expect any left-overs for dinner if you have a healthy appetite like mine.
author: Kristen S.

description:
Who's Koh Samui and where is his monkey? I looked it up on Wikipedia. Duh... turns out Koh Samui is Thailand's third largest island first inhabited about 15 centuries ago, settled by fishermen from Malay Peninsula and Southern China. Apparantly numerous animal attractions are dotted around the island, including a crocodile farm, monkey theatre, elephant trekking, a snake farm, an aquarium and a butterfly garden.  Sounds awesome! 

My friend picked this place for her bday dinner. Comfortable atmosphere and pretty good creative dishes. The six of us went family style and got 6 dishes to share which was the perfect amount of food. I recommend the Madame Sea Bass with green curry and the Pumpkin Curry Chicken. Everything else was decent except the Koh Tao Noodle which was heavy on the peanut sauce light on the noodles and everything else.
author: Debbie C.

description:
This place is GREAT!  My husband & I went here for my birthday and it is FAR better than any other Thai food I've had at a nice restaurant before (especially a LOT better than Osha Thai down the street).  It has a little Chinese fusion and their spicy food is SPICY.  Nothing is bland, everything is full of flavor and really good.  The service was great, ambiance is excellent and the lost dog posters in the bathroom are really weird, but unique & interesting  :)  I definitely recommend this place, one of the best in SOMA.

Had to reduce this to 4 stars because the next 2 times I went here the services was SOOOOOOO slow!
author: Amy P.

description:
My favorite Thai food restaurant. 
The chicken pumpkin curry is the bomb.
I also like the fire cracker. It's sizzling hot plate of sea food. I tried the 
The food here is great.Great Service
don't forget to order the appetizers
author: Ashley S.

description:
I really like the ambiance and Happy Hour menu at Monkey Bar. It was obvious that a lot of the workers from the nearby businesses come here for Happy Hour because the bar was pretty busy the whole time. 

Happy Hour menu was great! Drinks were pretty cheap, and pad thai was $6. A pretty decent amount was given too, and I judge a Thai Restaurant by its pad thai, and they passed. I had the THAIRISH COFFEE, which was really tasty! I wish they would put this on the Happy Hour menu...hint hint ;)

Service was ehh. They only visited our table once during our meal, but we were talking and catching up so we were okay with that.  I'll definitely come again for happy hour though.
author: Gina R.

description:
I work nearby and would come here at least twice a week for the garlic and pepper beef plate. The tofu for that seasoning is also good. 

I tried the same plate at another thai place nearby and it wasn't as good- the sauce was way too liquidy and the meat wasn't firm and seasoned enough to my liking. Color was also off. Last week, I cooked some at home but it didn't turn out to be quite as good- no surprise there.

I usually call in around 11:30AM to order the food and it would be ready in 15 mins. There was something weird about the payment option though. I went here with two different coworkers and they both encountered issues with them. One had a gift card for $50 but somehow it wasn't recognized so he wasn't able to use the (new) gift card. The second one went there all the time also but noticed they double charged her each 3 times. She informed them and they were nice about it- refunding her money and giving her a gift card. However, since none of that happened to me, I give this place a 4/5 stars. =]

I love their food but their service can use some work!
author: J. T.

description: Delicious food, nice dinner ambience and music, good friendly service (a few mins wait only for the check on a somewhat busy night). All of us found our dishes to be excellent. I had the veggie curry $10 & brown rice $3 - sounded so simple but the flavors were very rich. My friend had the Scallops $15, served on a bed of black noodles, the bite I had was excellent. Even the salad (papaya?) $9 was delicious, served in a big wooden bowl/pot. Our spring roll was a little too big for one bite and a little too messy for two, but with the sauce was delicious.
author: Jenni S.

description:
this place has gone seriously downhill. i went last year and i remember the food being great, but my meal last night was just plain bad. we had the fried calamari (decent, but deep fried anything is pretty hard to mess up), emperor steamed dumpling (dry and flavorless), grilled bangkok bbq chicken (very dry and bland; similar to chinese teriyaki chicken without the teriyaki sauce) and the sea bass mor din (unseasoned fish with a bunch of soggy vegetables). 

even with the $70 groupon (which they weren't pleased about at all; if your business is going to sell discounted coupons, DO NOT GET MAD WHEN PEOPLE USE THEM), our bill was $40 (granted we did have a bottle of wine) but it certainly wasn't worth the $110.

skip this place and go to sai jai or lers ros, you won't regret it and neither will your wallet.
author: Jae C.

description: This place pales in comparison to other Thai restaurants I've been too.  Nothing to rave about.  My friends and I shared two appetizers, none that were memorable, and 2 entrees.  I did like the pumpkin curry, but I'm not craving to go back anytime.  Good service and nice decor though!  The chairs were a bit heavy haha.
author: May W.

description:
Great spot for happy hour.

The bartender was kind and very knowledgeable. He let me try one of the beers on tap after expressing curiosity. They also have great cocktails.

The food was very good too. I really enjoyed the corn fritters. I don't eat curry but my friend had the coconut curry which came in an actual coconut! He thought the meal was delicious. 

Not sure I'd go back here for dinner due to my food preferences but I will definitely be back for happy hour!!
author: Jeanette L.

description:
We walked to Koh Samui & The Monkey after seeing Cirque du Soleil.  The atmosphere was inviting and the waitress handed us the menu and the $50 each set menu.  We immediately decided that was too much money and began to choose from the regular menu.  After a couple of minutes, we realized that we were about to order more than the set menu price, so we ordered it. 
  It came with 4 different wines and provided an array of dishes we have never tried,and each was more delicious than the previous one.
  We had come to SF on Caltrain; this restaurant is maybe 2 blocks from the station.
  A super place.
author: Torchy H.

description:
I wouldn't say that this place is the BEST Thai Restaurant in the City, but I will say that it's the PRETTIEST, NICEST and CLEANEST Thai Restaurant in the City.  Oh, and the service is pretty on point, too...

Their drink menu is pretty good...sake, beer, cocktails...makes for an awesome happy hour spot.  I had a Mango Mojito and it had a cute little monkey hanging from it...it soon ventured into our interesting Sake Carafe...sneaky lil' monkey!

The Chicken Mieng Kum is officially my FAVORITE Thai appetizer!  So much flavor from such a simple and beautiful dish!  A tiny piece of chicken, ginger, toasted coconut, a lime (with rind) and some peanut sauce atop a basil leaf is HEAVENLY!  The flavors explode in your mouth and makes for the perfect appetizer!  Light, tasty and healthy!    

Sadly, the heavenly goodness stops at the CMK.  Everything else was good, but didn't set itself apart from other Thai restaurants.  The Mango Beef was spicy, the Crispy Tofu had good flavor, but I wasn't "wowed".  

I'll definitely come back for the beautiful ambiance, monkey cocktails and of course, the Mieng Kum.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Stopped by here for lunch today with my co-workers and it was pretty good. It was busy, and the service was a bit off, but it looked like they only had 2 servers for the full restaurant. It wasn't a quick lunch - definitely took over an hour. I had the pad thai - which was good, but not as flavorful as some that I've had. It was also a bit on the small side.  Everyone else had the lunch meals, which looked pretty good. Pricewise, it seems like a good option. There's also a to-go side of the restaurant, which seemed pretty popular. 

Yum: Good appetizers, good lunch specials, to-go options

Bleh: Some things seemed pricey compared to others, smaller portions, super loud in the restaurant.
author: Sarah K.

description:
This place is good, not great.  There is nothing special about their dishes, both in terms of composition and taste.  The portions are small, but enough to fill you up.  I never doggy bag anything when I eat there :)

My favorite dishes are their pad see ew and duck noodle soup.  I would also add that I find their service to be above average.
author: Chris F.

description:
Really good thai food!  Sadly, we did not get enough of it - the portions were lacking!

Pumpkin curry - delicious!  you dont see pumpkin in enough dishes.  Great presentation, it came in a small green pumpkin.

Pineapple fried rice - Tasty as well, and came served in a carved out pineapple

sesame scallops - tasty!  had a good crust to them and were cooked just right.  However, there were only FOUR of them.  What the hell!  4 scallops do NOT make a meal.
author: richard d.

description:
This is a review for delivery, I've never been to the actual restaurant.  Delivery was prompt- only an hour which is normal.  

The food was really tasty, although not spicy enough.  I had to put a lot of sriracha on the Pad See Ew to give it some spice and more flavor.  The best was the Crying Tiger Salad- very minty and fresh.  Also, the Beef Mango Rice was remarkably tasty and the meat very high quality.  

I would recommend to anyone that has $40 to spend on a lunch for 2 people.
author: Jordan F.

description:
I'm happy with this place.

We had the spring role app (delish) and then I had the Pad Kee Mao with beef.  The noodles were sooo amazing. Just delicious and filling and well cooked. The whole dish was nicely seasoned, served nice and hot, and flavorful enough where I didn't have to add any hot sauce.

Will definitely be back.
author: Kym P.

description:
I had been hearing about this place for months and walking by it for months before I finally tried it, and I wanted to love it more than I did.

The food was good, the drinks were good, but I didn't think it was anything to write home about, and the price was really high considering that.  I had the pumpkin curry, and a drink that was served in a coconut, which was pretty cool.  The ambience was nice... but overall, I just wasn't blown away.
author: Samantha B.

description:
Our first night in the city, we had Thai @ Koh Samui. I started my search for delivery late and not many highly rated places were open, but I'm glad that was the case because then we found Koh.

Southern Ku-Kilng and Pad Thai were good. But here's the special part - Pumpkin Curry. I'm new to curry and I don't recall ever seeing this on the menu at Thai places in LA, so I ordered it. Amazing. Maybe it's because I apparently love pumpkin curry or maybe theirs is great, but either way I'm now a fan - thanks Koh & Monkey.
author: Michele A.

description: Came by for a quick bite and a drink. Had the yummy pork belly and a tasty drink from their gorgeous new bartender Anna.
author: Sergei T.

description:
Came here for lunch with my coworkers since it's right around the block for us. I suggested this place since my husband raves about their pad see ew and when he raves about something, I know it's going to be good. 

Of course, I got the pad see ew with chicken. This is actually the first time I've ever gotten this dish with chicken (I usually get it with beef). Either way, it was delicious. The noodles were soft, the whole dish was flavorful, the portion was huge. I was very full and happy. 

I'll definitely be back to try their other dishes. I love Thai food!
author: Lang T.

description:
I use to come to this place every week until recently, something drastically changed. 
The food use to be great here,  the portions were decent for the price and the staff was friendly. Now, the food is mediocre, the portions are not worth the price and the staff (especially at the "To-G0" side) are rude. 

A typical portion is two cups rice,  two tablespoons of food for $10.00!! No thank you, 
I'd much prefer to go to the thai restaraunt down the street where the food is better and it comes with soup, an appitizer and an entre for the the same price. 

Who wants to pay $10 for a bowl of rice with some sauce and a greenbean on it?
author: J L.

description:
3.5/5 funtimes

came here after walking for about a mile in the rain. my feet hurt and my socks were wet. breaking in new leather shoes sucks, but doing it for a mile in the rain pissed me off even more. my shoes are now broken in.

i met my friend at the restaurant, and we promptly seated ourselves right at the bar in front of the cute bartender, leo. he had just moved from london and was great to entertain us through our meal, even presented some drinks that were still in the works to get our opinion. hey free drinks are free drinks. and they were great!

we came here after work, so we were hitting up the happy hour menu. the drinks were pretty cheaply priced, and good at that. there was your standard selection of appetizers, but what made it a deal was that they even had pad see ew and pad thai on there for 7 each, which is a cheap dinner in the city with drinks. cozying up to the bar and have a good early dinner with a friend is better than having to fuss with a table. the food was good, the happy hour menu definitely wasn't just bar food.

i won't put in all the details about why we enjoyed our time there, but if you swing by, i'm sure leo will be as accommodating and friendly as he was with us. 

i would suspect that if i returned, i would have a higher rating for the place, but i'm going conservative since i did only try the limited happy hour menu. also, it's almost out to at&t park on 3rd, so unless you're already in soma, the spot is a little out of the way.
author: Alvin D.

description:
I am a fan of Osha so I decided to check this place out when some of the reviewers mentioned that they felt this was better than Osha.  First off, the ambiance of this restaurant is not better than Osha.  The next thing I noticed was that the prices were higher than Osha's. When I see a restaurant charging $16 for a curry, it better be some iron chef curry.

The food overall was good but not great and memorable.  The crispy imperial rolls and Pumpkin Curry are worth a try. My hubby had the Basil Gai which he uses as a measure for Thai Restaurants and he found it underwhelming and not worth it. The desserts did not seem appetizing enough to try for $10. 

For the quality of the food and the actual ambiance of this restaurant, I think the prices are double what they should be.
author: C L.

description:
3.5 stars is what I would like to give this place.

I came here over the weekend for a friend's birthday dinner. Nice ambience, full bar and good location.

Our waitress was a pretty gal but she seems like she's either new or just not very good at her job.  She didn't know the items on the menu very well and had us pointed our orders to her from the menu.  

The drinks came out swiftly and we're tasty, also, they had different beers to try from.  I would suggest the Mango Mojito. 

The appetizers arrived shortly and there was one dish we couldn't tell what it was, therefore we verified with our waitress.  She said it was the Tofu Mieng Kum, but we order the Chicken Mieng Kum and kindly apologized and we weren't upset seeing how everyone makes mistake.

After another ten minutes our entrees arrived and the server set down the Curry Sea Bass dish, we all asked each other who's this dish is for and realized none of us ordered it.  We, then again, had to asked our waitress over and turns out she gotten my ordered wrong, I ordered the Sea Bass Mor Din and not the Curry Sea Bass. While all my friends enjoyed their dinner, I sat there and waited nibbling from their dishes. Finally, my dish arrived after everyone was practically done.  Although, our waitress did give us a round of free shots to compensate her mistakes but there were several other mistakes here and there.

I enjoyed their Jasmine Creme Brulee the most out of everything.

Last, but not least, I noticed that when the server brought out my bowl of rice her thumb was deep into the bowl =T
author: Mimi P.

description:
Genuine rating probably around 3.5 stars for the food, but the service was pretty good so - 4 stars it is!

Came here for a good sized group dinner last week and am pleased to say that my dining experience here has turned around my general reluctance to eat Thai. (long story short: went to thailand. indigestion. avoided anything thai that wasn't pad thai for years thereafter.)

In any case, we tried 3 appetizers - the corn cakes, calamari and fish sticks and 5 different entrees including the well-reviewed vegetarian pumpkin curry, the firecracker seafood mix, the grilled pork, chicken pad thai, and something else that escapes me at the moment.

Some of my friends also ordered drinks - a cucumber drink that was quite good...  thai iced coffee that was creamy and delicious, a crazy calpirnha drink with some weird ingredients (strawberry jalapeno + something else).

The service was attentive, although the kitchen was a bit slow -- our server apologized for later and brought everyone free shots to compensate -- ++ bonus points ++!   But we were all busy chatting and catchin up anyway (while sneaking looks at the game on tv) so the lag wasn't a big deal at all.
author: Rachel M.

description:
What the hay?

I don't know if it was just an off day or if they're slippin'.

Went here for lunch like I have many times before. Service was super slow. Curry was cold. Rice was undercooked.

I spent $15+ for lunch and left starving.
author: Mary L.

description:
Everything was mediocre. We ordered the tom kha gai soup (too much coconut milk for me), papaya salad (good but nothing special), string beans (too salty!) and the sea bass. 

Also, I was disappointed that when we asked our waiter to recommend a dish, he suggested the string beans when we already ordered the sea bass which apparently comes with string beans. Talk about string bean overload.
author: Helen Y.

description: My husband and I eat here too often. This place is so comfortable like home and almost every menu is delicious. It tastes like the food cooked at home. The interior design is decent, and I like the kindness of their employees. It's not a very fancy place but there is nothing to complain in general.
author: Hyejin K.

description: Ordered the pad thai and salmon red curry take out. The pad thai was pretty meh. The curry was tasty enough, but not amazing or anything. A little on the mild side. I was a little surprised the curry didn't come with rice, but I had some left over that I could eat with it.
author: Emily F.

description: Very much enjoyed the scallops with sesame seeds.  We also had the beef mango.  I was originally skeptical of the combination but It was tasty.  I may have actually enjoyed the mango more than the beef.
author: Maxwell S.

description:
Food: Tasty and full of flavor
Ambiance: Very Pretty Restaurant with Great Decorations
Service: Horrible
Price: Overpriced for what you are getting

Came here with 7 other coworkers after work before a trip to a Giants Game. We had seen the Happy Hour Menu online, which looked really good. We had all gotten very excited by the HH menu--not only did the food look pretty good, but it was also decently priced compared to the overpriced items on their regular menu. When we got to the restaurant, we were informed that we could only order Happy Hour at the bar. We asked if we could all get drinks at the bar first, and then bring it to our table--she said no, we could only drink at the bar for HH. OK, so then we asked if we could get drinks at the bar, drink them at the bar, pay for them, and then move over to the table for dinner--she said no. 

We finally decided to just sit at the table since there wasn't even room for us at the bar. I handed her my opentable coupon and ordered:
1) Fire Cracker: seafood Sizzling hot plate of prawns, squid, scallop, crab claw and spicy peanut sauce
- This dish was very very good and had a lot of flavor.

2) Aromatic Pumpkin Curry* chicken, bell pepper in red curry sauce served in pumpkin
- This dish looks small, but there is a lot of curry in this pumpkin. It also has a nice kick to it. The curry tastes great with the rice!

3) a fried pork belly dish
- yummy fatty goodness, but small dish

4) a green noodle dish
- This dish was tasty, but probably the least interesting of all the dishes we got. 

I also ordered a $12 alcoholic drink served in a Coconut. For a $12 drink, i expected something much better. This was not a tasty drink and definitely did not go down easily. I needed my friends to help me finish this drink because while it was a good sized drink, it was hard to swallow. I can make a better tasting drink at home. 

After finishing our meal, it was obvious that we wanted to leave. The busboys took our plates, we were looking at our watches, and turning our heads around looking for our waitress.  About 15 to 20 minutes later, i got up, walked to the waitress, and asked her for the check. 
I walked back to my table and a few minutes later she hands me my bill--she forgot my opentable certificate. i flagged her down again to remind her and she took my receipt back and produced another one with the correct amount.

As we left, we saw that the table behind us--a group of 6--had just ordered HH drinks at the bar and carried it to their table. The waitress did not say a thing or seemed to care. This was NOT a good way to end a dinner. My party was thoroughly ticked off after this. 


---Thank Goodness we had a great time at the Giants Game. It Saved Our Night---
author: Peggy L.

description:
this place is very dim and the decor seems to be nice. it is indeed damn small and the tables are placed way too close to each other. We were sat between two table and i can hear both tabes' conversation. I went on a saturday night and it was a very loud in the building.

let's get to the point:
1 star for food - it was good, not HELLA GOOD. I got the pumpkin curry that everyone on yelp raved about  and i was in the mood for curry. My significant other got pad see eew (sp?). The curry was more chunky rather than juicy. (don't know if this should be label curry). her dish was decent, we had better pad see eew elsewhere.

1 star for friendly servers not service. the service was decent, i would give them half a star for their service. We ordered our dishes within 5 mins after sitting but our main dish didn't come out til an hour later. WOW,  we almost fell off our chair listening to the two tables talk.

1 star for groupon deal. seriously! i only came here cuz i got the groupon deal. the price is expensive for the small portion. although i didn't finish my dish because i got full from waiting. i did finish it that same night when i got home.

i would have given them 2.5 stars but rounding it up to 3.

would I come back? not at all.
author: Hung V.

description:
I LOVE the happy hour here.  2.50 Stellas and other tasty beers, and deals on wine and booze as well.  The bar menu is hit or miss but the sit down dinner menu is all hits.  Curry that may even be better than Osha and a slightly more authentic menu than Osha.

Even cute pictures of lost er ads in the restrooms.  

Cozy atmosphere with lots of windows.

They deliver, as well, but I've seen it take over an hour and a half.  In house, no speed problems.
author: Lauren J.

description: Decent Thai food, nothing out of the ordinary. +1 star for having Delirium Tremens! Great ambiance, good spot for a date.
author: Kiran J.

description:
I have been to Koh Samui three times now, twice for dinner and once for lunch. The first time we had dinner there I completely forgot if I liked it or not- not a terribly good thing, I must say. The second time, it was excellent- the food was flavorful and delicious, and everything we tried was up to par with an upscale Thai place. 

The lunch visit though, was not good at all. The food was decent, but it took us 55 minutes to get it. We came before the lunch rush at 11:30. There were only two other two-tops filled when we went in, one table was finishing up their lunch and wine, the others had already ordered. We ordered pretty quickly, being accustomed to Thai food we didn't need much time to decide. The place started to fill up, people placed their orders. Said people got their orders, but we did not. No one stopped by our table to let us know the reason for the hold up. It was almost as if we were in a shadowed spot of the restaurant, out of sight out of mind.

The food was good though, the Mango Beef had my dad singing praises. Regardless, we couldn't shake the fact that we had to wait nearly an hour to have what should have been a quick meal. Pardon the pun, but it left a bad taste in our mouths.

I'm not too convinced on this place. I like the food, but a hot spot needs to have more than just better than decent food. I have been to a lot of Thai places in SF and I'm starting to think I'd rather take the time to walk from SoMa to the Tenderloin to get some good Thai food in a place where the people watching is good and the food is served up quickly.

Perhaps they were just having an off lunch hour? Not sure.
author: Tawnee K.

description: My favorite Thai restaurant in the bay area! The drinks are great and the coconut curry is the best I've had. The atmosphere is the perfect level of classy without being too fancy. LOVE this place!
author: Melody S.

description: Best thai food i've had next to Osha in the city
author: Deven P.

description:
What started out as a near disaster of a family dinner was redeemed for the most part by the time we left the restaurant.

We were the first customers at 5 p.m. and barely got noticed. Seated away from the service staff, by a blustery window, no one noticed that we had hungry and thirsty children that needed to be seen to asap!

 They could not decided which juices they had and which they hadn't - and precious time was spent going back and forth -- now we have it, now we don't...and to top it off, spilt an ENTIRE glass of cranberry juice all over the table, filling up my daughters fuzzy ballet flats! Though profusely apologetic, the servers appeared flustered and scattered, taking away our cups (to change the table covers) and forgetting to return them. The food also took FOREVER to arrive, surprising since we were the only people there at 5 p.m. 

Food was passable, not horrible, but definitely nothing to write home about. Here's the lo-down.

Tom Gha Kai: very sweet and super creamy... to the point of feeling your arteries harden while still drinking it. 

Tom Yum Pla: Too many mushrooms, too little fish, more sweet than tangy, needed more galangal and more kaffir lime leaves.

Sesame encrusted scallops: Delicious. Hard to find fault with.

Pad thai: meh.

Crispy tofu: Peanut sauce with spinach to ground the tofu was an interesting and delicious touch.

The crowning moment of the night was when the waiter came and offered a free dessert for spilling juice on us. 

Everyone one knows that Thai food shines in the apps, soups and desserts (more so than the entrees) and we all enjoyed our mango over sticky rice -- that platter was left CLEAN!

All that said and done... 3 stars for okay food and service that at least (kinda)tries.
author: Corrinne L.

description:
Food and drinks here were good.  Dined here last night for a girlfriend's surprise birthday dinner...

We had a pretty large group (about 15 people) and they were able to accommodate our size.  They give you an option of ordering off of a pre fixe menu (4 people min) and off the regular menu.  I thought that was a nice option...

We ordered several dishes and decided to eat family style (papaya salad, spring rolls, a steak dish, a tofu dish - just to name a few) and they were all tasty.

Ambiance was also nice.  Decorated well with Thai artifacts, masks, and intricate wood pieces.  

Nice dining environment + good food = great night out with friends!
(Bonus because the birthday girl was genuinely surprised!)
author: Starleigh H.

description:
I'm giving a 5 star rating not only for the food and ambiance, but especially the service.

We came here on the night that we were going to Cirque Du Soleil. The show was at 8 and we arrived at the restaurant at 7. Even though it was a Wednesday night, the place was pretty full. We told them right up front that we had a show and that we would need to be out of there by 7:45. While waiting to be seated, we took a look at the menu and figured out what we wanted to order. We were seated and ordered by 7:15. All of the food was out within the next 10 mins--a total of 5 dishes which i'll get to in a second--and we were done right on time. The waiters were very attentive and friendly, and they got us in and out right in time, I really appreciated that.

Now back to the food:

Larb Gai-excellent. Larb is a salad of sorts, which is mainly composed of a meat (or tofu), onion, cilantro, lime, fish sauce, and chili. They do it very well here and it's served in a bell pepper. We also ordered the green papaya salad. Not much to say here, other than it was fresh and tasty.

Duck---something, i can't exactly remember what, but it was served with a soy based sauce and spinach and it was amazing--succulent, succulent duck. Unfortunately it was kinda skmipy.

Pad Thai- again, not much to say here, it's pad thai. I didn't order this one. I never order pad thai. We actually had a discussion about this before ordering, one of the other people said that pad thai is the best way to tell if the thai restaurant is any good...a barometer of sorts to gauge the place. I personally disagree, i feel like pad thai is like ordering refried beans at a Mexican restaurant, it doesn't really tell you anything. The curries are where it's at! to me pad thai is a waste of a dish, but some people like to stick with what they know, what are you going to do?

Southern Curry. Beef panang curry. So amazingly good, it was a great blend of sweet and spicy and it was a thick curry sauce--it really stuck to the meat and rice and added a lot of flavor. THAT was the gauge for me and it was really good.

The ambiance here is nice too, it was actually kind of a bummer that we were in a rush, because it would have been nice to hang out for a while. 

So for the food, the ambiance, and especially the service, 5 stars for me. I would definitely come back.
author: Daniel G.

description: Delicious.  I love their corn puffs, cucumber salad, vegetarian yellow curry, and chicken satay skewers.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Anything named after a Monkey can't be bad...And this place was so freakin delicious!!!!!  Plus, I love monkeys :D

Had the asparagus with seafood and it was so yummy that I became anti-social amongst my co-workers and shoveled the food on down.  The place was really clean and well lit.  The service was friendly and quick and the price was just right! 

I will definitely come back and get my  monkey groove on!

Woot! Wooty woot! Woot! I love monkeys!!!!


^_^
author: Duckie A.

description:
I have been here 3 times now and have yet to be disappointed. While I am not totally blown away by the food here I continue to return because it is a solid option and my feelings about the place have remained unchanged. 
. 
The last time I dinned here I was in a group of five. It was Saturday night (7pm) and we did not have a reservation but they were able to seat us almost right away. The place is always clean and the decor is nice. The service has consistently been fast and friendly.

For the appetizers we ordered the vegetarian samosas and chicken & beef satay.  My only wish is that they brought more. There wasn't enough for us to each have one samosa so we had to share. 

For the main course I ordered the Spicy Tofu with extra wide rice noodles (which are my favorite). It was not as spicy as it could have been but it was very good. I have had trouble finding the extra wide rice noodles at other Thai restaurants and so The Monkey gets a star for having them!

The rest of the guests ordered a variety of dishes with a general consensus: good. 

If you are looking for a good lunch this is the place, if you are looking for an amazing dinner you might be setting the bar too high for The Monkey.
author: Tuesday C.

description:
If there were half stars, I'd probably give this place 3.5. I can't deny liking the food here, but I do have a fair number of complaints:

1) The dishes are expensive. You can often compare restaurants by a standard dish; in this case, Pad Thai with chicken. It costs $12 here, while other places often have it for around $7 but definitely less than $10. Also, there were not many noodles at all. Additionally, they charge for rice no matter what you order; other places often serve rice with a curry dish, but not this place.

2) The service wasn't very good. We went after 9pm one night when the place was relatively empty. Our waitress rarely swung by after she took our order. In fact, we had to ask for chopsticks and order another serving of rice through the bus boy.

3) It's hard to believe that this place doesn't have the standard Chicken Yellow Curry, a fairly standard dish at other Thai places. I can understand if they want to be unique, but you can do that while still offering popular dishes that many like. That being said, I highly recommend the Aromatic Pumpkin Curry (chicken, bell pepper in red curry sauce served in pumpkin).

Again, the food is tasty but also expensive and the service isn't very good/attentive.
author: John C.

description: Really chill atmosphere, good service, adequate amounts of food that is tasty and looks good.
author: Reeti B.

description:
I'm Thai. And I approve. 

Authentic curry, great service, wonderful decor. Price is unbeatable.
author: Alisa A.

description:
We've been going here for years now. The service has always been fabulous, and the food is always great! Very nice servers, and the food comes out quickly.

This is definitely our go to for Thai in San Fran!
author: Lauren E.

description:
I live and work around the corner from Koh Samui and the Monkey. I eat here all the time. I think the Thai food is pretty good. I like the corn fritters, yellow chicken curry, the pad sew eww w beef, and the papaya salad. The restaurant is really cute. If you have been to Koh Samui before you would understand the lost dog pictures in the restrooms. hahaha THERE are nothing but stray dogs at Koh Samui, so when I saw the pics...I thought it was hilarious. 

The only thing I'm not too found of their is the Thai ice tea...its TOO sweet! 

There is also a full bar too! BTW!
author: Sandy L.

description: The food is decent and the service is pretty good, while the prices remain high and the portions remain small.
author: SF R.

description:
This used to be my favorite thai place in the city (have been going here for the last 4 years).

Tonight however, they messed up my to go order (both the items I ordered we incorrect) and also took forever (+40min) to get the food ready. I told them the order on the receipt wasn't what I had asked for before they gave the food, but the waitress insisted it was the same item.

Too bad, there are a bunch of other thai places in the same neighborhood, I'm going to check the other ones out next time.
author: Alok M.

description:
Went here for the pre-set menu for New Years Eve and had a great experience.  I had been to this restaurant once before and thought it was pretty good then.  The New Years Eve dinner though blew the previous experience away.

The pre-set dinner was normally $60 per person, but since my friends and I did the vegetarian option, we only had to pay $50 each.

The drink that we all got was the Apricot Monkey.  That drink itself was $14 on the menu, so we were happy about that.  It was an exceptional drink as well.  It was a tad sweet but good.

The surprise of the night was the appetizer.  Since there were three of us, we got the perfect amount for everyone to have a taste of everything.  It included the samosas, stay tofu, fried tofu, corn cake, spring rolls, and mango salad.  Even if most of it was fried, it was amazing.  I am Thai and thought it was an exceptional presentation as well as good tasting.  I loved the samosas and the spring rolls.

We than got soup which was tom kha vegetables with tofu.  It was really creamy and strong in flavor.  I didn't like it too much, but it wasn't bad.  Definitely would have been better to eat with rice than as a opening soup dish.

The dishes we got were spicy tofu, pad Thai tofu, and pumpkin curry.  My favorite one was the pad thai.  It wasn't as moist as other pad Thais I've had before, but it was flavorful enough and not too sweet which equates good!  The spicy tofu was my second favorite.  It was great with the brown rice... yes they gave us brown rice, another plus.  The pumpkin curry wasn't bad but could have had more pumpkin (not that we couldn't scrape off pumpkin from the pumpkin bowl it came in).

And finally we had desert: Two banana thing and one chocolate cake.  The chocolate cake gave me some strange spasm, so I was somehow allergic to it or something.  I didn't eat it after the first two bites.  The banana thing was okay.  I was full anyway, so I didn't mind the desert not being better than I want it to be.  It all also came with a mango ice cream.

So based on my review, it should be about 3.5 stars right?  Here's the other good thing about dinner, the service.  Our waitress was awesome!  If it wasn't her coming to ask how everything was, there were others always filling our waters and taking empty plates.  Exceptional!  And we also ended up getting a wine as a gift for being there.  All in all, everything we had eaten and got was probably worth more than the $50 price tag.  I will definitely be coming back here again to get a meal without desert.
author: Andrew N.

description: I was a big fan of Citizen Thai and the Monkey - great fun place for groups.  Koh Samui & The Monkey has a nice decor but definitely doesn't have the same fun group vibe.  Having said that, it's a reliable place for Thai with great cocktails and I've had many a good meal there.  The food is very good, but not amazing.   The fresh rolls are too loose and fall apart.  The pad thai is drenched in too much sauce and doesn't taste as good as the one at Basil Thai.  But the food is still far better than the glamorized/Americanized dishes at Osha Thai, and I just discovered that they deliver with a minimum purchase of $30 so that's a huge plus!
author: Vivian W.

description: I felt as though all the dishes were missing the ingredients with flavor.  Maybe it is because it was delivery and they don't care, I'm not sure.  Too many options to eat here again.
author: Eric T.

description: I made a reservation here for a first date. The atmosphere gave us plenty to talk about, and the service was great! I'm glad my date and I got their a little early, because as soon as we got our wine, the place filled up very quickly. We had the pumpkin curry and pad thai, and both were delicious. We had such a great experience that this place has been our "usual place" since.
author: Nicolle B.

description: I've been here twice for lunch and both times I was very happy with the service here. The wait staff is incredibly nice and accommodating. The second time, especially, our waitress was more than happy to serve us and make sure we had an enjoyable time. Also, the food is excellent. Of all the Thai restaurants I've eaten at, I think Koh Samui & The Monkey makes the best papaya salad and larb gai. I look forward to coming back here and trying more dishes!
author: Christopher C.

description:
I've eaten here a number of times, both on a date and with a group of friends. The atmosphere of the restaurant is far nicer than the prices and perhaps location would suggest. It's a great part of the South Beach / AT&T neighborhood. It's also fairly quick, so we were able to fit in dinner here in under 1.5 hours on a Saturday night.

The assorted appetizer tray is a must if you're at a table of at least 3 or 4 people. It's mostly little pieces of fried food, but it's so tasty! The ingredients all taste really fresh, too.

My favorite dish is the peanut tofu. The peanut sauce is a bit overwhelming, though, and the dish comes off much more creamy than it is spicy. So I don't think it's the perfect execution of the dish, but I still appreciate the attentive service (hey, I get thirsty while eating, don't you?) and the good variety of food.

One oddity: they always have sort of dance music playing in the background, and the TV is showing something like sports games. A bit out of place with the furniture and the general feel of the restaurant. Also, the bathrooms are decorated with photocopied fliers of lost cats. Actually, this restaurant is sounding stranger and stranger as I talk about it...
author: Sharon W.

description: Soooooo sad I have to do to do this since I love the food and decor here.  But what good is that if the service is BEYOND sh*tty? Wrong appetizer served, forgot our drinks, waited more than 45 minutes for our meal and that was AFTER we prompted the hostess (since the owner is in Thailand and the manager went home early).  Our server (who's name is Beer) turned a night of hopeful anticipation for a fun evening out into a disappointing aggravation.
author: Clever Chick I.

description:
The panang curry is so good, it's addictive. I've worked nearby for three years and never been disappointed by the food or service. I'm also a big fan of the new Koh Samui to go that's open during lunch, it's fast, it's cheap and it's delicious. They'll give you a 50 cent discount if you bring your own container, you gotta love SF trying to be green. 

A couple of people have mentioned Ozone nearby as a good alternative but I disagree.  I've had a couple of lunches there and the quality of food does not compare at all. Koh Samui & The Monkey is much, much better.

Lastly, their catering service is awesome. Order at 11am, gets to my office at noon and I have a roomful of happy people. It can be pricey but online ordering is smooth and they are very reliable. Highly recommended!
author: Allison B.

description: Very yummy! I love the pumpkin curry. If you're in the area and want Thai, go here - avoid the others nearby because you will pay too much for far too little in quantity, flavor, and manners.
author: Katherine R.

description:
pricey, tasty, small portions.
curry roasted duck over rice. red curry with nice spice and not too sweet. just right on the taste scale but really kind of a rip off on the amount of duck. I know I am not in Chinatown here but puh leeze. give me just a little more meat than three pieces. and leaving here after dropping $18 on the lunch special and a diet coke is a little outrageous. the lunch special also included an ap of your choice deep fried spring roll or a rice paper shrimp and pork roll. i chose the later and it had good flavor and a nice peanut sweet and tangy dipping sauce.  definitely an expense account lunch spot.
author: Jeff W.

description: Good food, pricey for thai food during dinner, the gal who served us had a bad attitude.  The panang beef with sticky rice is a must try.
author: Benjamin T.

description: Very average to me, though it is possible I ordered wrongly.  I had the pumpkin curry with beef and the clay pot glass noodles.  The beef was old and plain bad; while the noodle dish was pretty decent, with a layer of fluffy, creamy sea bass on the bottom.  If I'm back here again, I may try some other dishes since I have heard good things about this place, but the beef curry was a very disappointing dish.
author: Josh Q.

description:
I came for lunch today. We arrived at 11:45 and got seated with ease. Even at its peak on a Thursday, it never filled up completely. 

The Tom Kha Gai was ok, but the Panang Beef was much tastier. The Chicken Satay was perfectly done and had a yummy peanut sauce. 

The servers were friendly and did a great job. 

Based on the prices, I wouldn't make a production out of trying to eat here, but it's good for lunch if you're in the area and want some Thai food.
author: Philip F.

description:
A new work assignment puts me in China Basin a couple times a week (new territory for yours truly) and I'm excited about it because it lets me try a ton of new spots!

Today's lunch was here at Koh Samui and it was delicious!  It started with the tea that was ordered by my earlier-arriving colleague, which was delightful (even though I was already loaded up with caffeine!).

I went with one of their lunch specials:  veggie rolls and pumpkin curry shrimp.  I did my research on our favorite web site and people raved about the pumpkin curry so I went for it.  And they were right!  Great flavor, perfect amount of spice and overall the right amount of food (satisfied and not stuffed).

The restaurant itself is has nice decor and gets great sunlight at lunchtime (when there isn't fog, of course).  So all in all, I really enjoyed my meal here and I will return after I get to try all the other cool spots down here.

I guess the dogpatch is next for me...
author: John K.

description:
This is definitely a neighborhood favorite. We bring all of our out of town guests here and the locals too. The service is always fast and good and although we usually call ahead, we've never had to wait for a table. 

The pumpkin curry is my favorite. It tastes delicious and the presentation is amazing because it comes in a pumpkin which usually blows our out of town guests away. We also like ordering the pineapple fried rice for that reason because it comes in a pineapple. However, the pineapple fried rice will probably only feed two people so you'll need to order more. We like their brown rice and coconut rice.

Other favorites are the beef mango. Being Indian, we also love the veggie samosas as appetizers that come with a nice sweet and sour sauce and tastes just like you would get at an Indian restaurant. My friend always get the tofu and eggplant that she loves. 

The mango and sticky rice and flaming dessert are great paired with the herbal teas. Remember to order your dessert early because they usually won't take any more dessert orders after 10:30pm or so.

Almost anything we tried there is good. Although I've been there for the lunch-time specials too, I prefer dinner because of the presentation. The pumpkin curry doesn't come in a pumpkin during lunch...enough said! :)
author: Sheena S.

description: Excellent Thai food, lately it's been a little easier to get seated quickly for lunch. Has pre-set menu options.
author: Iggy V.

description:
Yes. This is what Thai food tastes like.

I got their famous pumpkin curry with chicken (takeout). The flavor was rich and sublime, the sauce thick and fragrant. My only complaint is the amount of chicken I got...but I can forgive them.

The restaurant also operates a small adjoining small takeout counter, where you can choose one dish for 7 bucks or two for 8, with about 10 dishes to choose from. I'll probably try that next time.
author: David Z.

description: ....Don't let the lunch crowd of young tekkies fool you, while I'm no expert on Thai food, I do know mediocre when I see it...a bit on expensive side for what they dish out....when we asked for tea it was served up luke warm in a cracked and stained pot...
author: jim b.

description:
The pumpkin curry is a must get here.  seriously, get it.  you won't regret it.  The pad see ew is also really yummy.

I followed some other yelpers and got the chicken mien kum.  Um.  What.  Maybe they were having a bad night, because I did not enjoy this at all.  It just had a weird flavor to it.  I think eating a lime wedge WITH THE RIND kind of killed it for me.  On the other hand, the corn fritters were really good.

The food here wasn't too bad, and the service was ok, so 3 stars it is.  I would definitely come back for the pumpkin curry though.
author: Jessie H.

description: Ordered delivery and was told 50 minutes to 1 hour. An hour and a half later called back in to check status and was told delivery was out and should be there soon after the employee checked. Called back after 2 hours had passed and they apologized and said they never had the order but would reissue it at 20% off. Not acceptable. Especially after confirming my order after one followup. If hungry, don't count on these guys.
author: Tim H.

description:
I thought this place was great. The ambiance was much better than most Thai places in the city (at least the ones I've been to so far). Service was good, fresh spring rolls were DELICIOUS and my main dish was great as well. Some things on the menu are a little pricier than you might expect at a Thai restaurant, but there are plenty of reasonably-priced options as well. My friend and I split an appetizer and entree and each got a cocktail - paid $26 each.   

The only reason I'm docking a star is that my drink was TERRIBLE. I got the Thai Kiss which sounded delicious but something was just not quite right. I could barely finish it. I hate wasting alcohol so I managed to put it down, but it wasn't exactly pleasant. 

Still, the food was fantastic, nice atmosphere and good service. I would definitely go back.
author: Priya N.

description:
The ambiance is pretty cool.  I like the little TO-GO entrance next to the regular sit down entrance.  
About the food:
- Cooked decent
- Not authentic thai - the dishes are blended for those who can't handle spicy.  It caters to the non-asian crowd.
- Presentation is nice

About the TO-GO food:
- Different menu each day which is great
- Food is not hot, but warm (which sucks) since it's barely resting on the warming plates
- The amount of food given is so-so.  They used to give more but suddenly they went on a "i want more profit" mood and cut back on the quality of the to-go boxes (mine was a cardboard box which was soaking wet when i got back to my office).  
- I asked for red chili sauce and I got a teaspoon worth in the little carry-out container.  I can't do any damage to my mouth with that.


I like to eat at a place minimum of twice before reviewing, and well their quality went down.  Chicken was cold and hard last time I got it.  Either it was over cooked or warmed up from the day before.

But hey, with all that MSG and sauce, it all tastes the same.   3 stars for tasting like any other lame thai place.  Wish you kept up the quality!


-
author: Milan D.

description:
Based upon what I had to eat and the service I enjoyed this gets top rating. My only complaint was too much lemon grass in the Tom Kar Gai soup but other than that perfect. 

The broth in my soup was amazing. I wanted more of it and more and more! Then the Crying tiger Salad was out of this world. It was a lettuce and thai herb salad with lime spiced beef, red onions with an amazing lime vinaigrette that had a hint of fish sauce. I was having a Thai orgasm and I am a white boy! 

My waiter was great! He was this very hip looking dude with tats, a nicely groomed beard and the most amazing blue eyes. Personality was just as amazing. 

I have been to Koh Samui half dozen times and each time was good but this time was GREAT! 

From the looks of the crowds they are doing a find job!
author: Scott P.

description:
Attention: Do NOT order online here!!!  When you get there to pick up your order, you will be waiting forever!  I took advantage of a Living Social Takeout deal.  I put in my order soon after the restaurant opened - which, by the way, was at 11:10am, a good chunk of time before peak lunch time.  The soonest the restaurant allows for pickup is in "about 1 hour."  I knew that word "about" was a red flag, but I went for it anyway.

Having even called 20 min. beforehand to make sure they had my order and that it would be ready ("yes it should be ready in 20 minutes."), I got to the restaurant shortly before 12:10pm.  The hostess at the front desk checked on my order and cheerfully said "it'll just be a minute."  15 minutes later, I'm still standing around watching hot food being whisked to all the dine-in customers in front of me.  Excuse me?  The restaurant should have planned for my order since I placed it over an hour ago!!

This is to Koi Samui management:  Hello!  If your chefs can't handle online orders, then don't go offering the option to your customers!!  I've had pleasant dine-in experiences here before, but this terrible takeout experience cancels out all those other experiences.  Not only that, but you decide to raise the prices of the food for the Living Social customers - yes, I noticed - about 44% higher.  Very uncool!!!

Oh, and by the way, there's a takeout section adjacent to the dining area which is set up like a buffet.  But no, if you made an online order, you do not get service in the takeout section.  Another smart move, management!

The only reason I did not give this place 1 star was that the food was actually really tasty...once I finally got it!  Also, the hostess was very nice and kept checking on my food every few minutes.  I know it wasn't her fault, so I don't blame her.  I won't be coming back, though, after this experience.  Good job, Koi Samui management.  You just lost a customer.
author: A Y.

description:
I wish I could write a better review for this place but it was one messup after another, and on Valentine's Day no less. As it is, this place very nearly ruined Valentine's Day for us.

We'd taken care to get our reservation in for Valentine's Day weeks before. They called to confirm, we had the confirmation email. What happens when we get there? We get told our reservation is not on the list at all, and they refused to seat us to boot - we had to dig out the email on my bf's phone for them to even give us a table.

The hostess then apologizes profusely and hastily gives us the tiny table along the aisle between the wall and the bar stools. Which turns out to be extremely drafty, and since I was dressed for the evening out I was shivering with cold and nearly got sick by the time the night was over.

I'm not the sort to be turned off a good meal by cold, bad/rude service or crappy decor. But I've eaten better at holes-in-the-wall and this time the mixup with the reservations could not be saved by the food. My Royal Curry with the red curry sauce option was horribly undercooked and I was so hungry by the time the food arrived that I just ate it anyway. The vegetables (carrots, etc) were hard, tofu in it was bland. The only good thing about the curry was the sauce, which kind of tasted like it simply had been poured on. My bf's pumpkin curry was better and tasted like it had been properly stewed a while, but for $16 a portion, I'm expecting a great curry, and not merely a small portion of decent curry I could cook at home. Since we had gotten a Bloomspot deal I decided to have a pumpkin curry without the chicken. Which cued a repeat performance of blah-ness, though since squash is so easy to cook, it was soft enough for me.  The curry sauce did not fare so well and tasted hastily slapped on yet again.

We probably should have demanded they take back the Royal curry and complained about our reservation, but BF and I aren't the types to make a scene. If you are a curry enthusiast, and/or wanting to take no chances on impressing on special dinner date, this is a place best left unvisited.

Edit: To the poster who called me an idiot - Oh sure, because other people have lives (including myself) to the extent they're busy on Valentine's Day and go to a restaurant post-work or college totally invalidates their previous review that the food sucked. I know what good curry tastes like and if you got offended that I slammed your favorite haunt, sorry, but it doesn't work that way. I say to you - I have standards when I eat, and I wouldn't have chosen this place, V-day or no, if I'd known the food and service was this bad. Had the restaurant cared about its customers they would have saved us a table in the main dining area, as well. My opinion still stands.
author: Kit A.

description: The restaurant is very nice. My family have a wonderful dinner last Sunday. I would like to strongly recommend the  crispy imperial roll and giant king crab. They taste really good.  Chicken mieng Kim tastes good too; however, you will find it is too expensive in term of its amount. Btw, chicken pumpkin curry is not put into the whole pumpkin any more, it makes me  feel a little bit disappointed. I would Iike to  give 4 stars to this restaurant as the food are delicious.
author: Changsheng L.

description:
Okay, I can't lie... I picked it because of the name.

We were headed to Cirque Du Soliel for a friend's surprise birthday present, and took them here for the pre-game. Unfortuantely, it was raining, traffic got held up and we were 30 minutes late. The good news is that we were able to get seated and eat a delicious dinner in record time despite the place being packed and understaffed.

Extra bonus star for great service and delicious food.

I would recommend people come here for a more leisurely paced dinner where they can take advantage of the street-view SOMA setting and tasty food. We definitely will be back.
author: K. C.

description:
The food at Koh Samui and the Monkey was very good. We ordered the fresh spring rolls, pumpkin curry and mango beef. They were are great. The service was also excellent. 

My main complaint (the reason for the 3 stars) are the prices. We each ordered a side of rice with our meal. The sides of rice were $3 each ($9 total). Most Thai restaurants give you a huge pot of rice for the table, for about $1.50. Also, my friend ordered a side of steamed vegetables to mix in with her food, and that was $4.50 for a few pieces of broccoli and baby corn.  

I can see myself going back, since I live so close by. But, I would definitely order entrees that do not need rice. If we hadn't ordered the rice and vegetables, the prices would have been quite reasonable.
author: Vickie D.

description:
This review is for the lunch take-out as I haven't been for a sit-down meal yet.

Koh Samui (or, as we call it in the office, "Monkey Thai") has a tasty and fast to-go lunch. It's in a little room off to the side from their main dining room, and it's just a little buffet where you can order a combination plate of one or two items with white or brown rice. I had the sweet basil chicken which was really good, sort of like a Thai version of sweet-and-sour chicken but with a lot of basil in the mix. They have a small selection of sodas and some Thai iced tea as well if you want that. The lunch takeout is supposed to be cash-only but if you only have a card they'll give you a receipt with your total and have you take it over to the main area where the hostess will run your card for you and give you back a receipt that you can then exchange for your food.

I want to come back for dinner sometime, so I'll update when I do.
author: Sam K.

description: Just simply good Thai food. The ambiance is great, friendly Thai waitresses and an awesome bar.  Really great curry's for seafood or meat and then yummy appetizers and noodles.  I don't understand why people are so critical with these reviews- it's good food for a reasonable price!
author: Holly M.

description: For the price, this is one of the best places I've eaten in SOMA.  Great prices (rare in Sf), great atmosphere, great service, and a great tofu pad thai.   This is one of my go to restaurants ... go to it!
author: Nick O.

description: Visited this place before a Giants game when another place we went to was closing up suggested it. Came to this place just in time for the happy our specials at the bar. Most items were $5-6 dollars each. Had some Pad Thai, Pad se Ew and some other appetizers. It was well worth trying and service was quick.
author: Wil Y.

description:
Great Happy Hour!
I went on a Friday about 6pm and enjoyed happy hour.  $3 house wine and $7 for a good portion of curry chicken and rice.  Very yummy curry chicken, some of the best I've ever had!!  And, for those happy hour prices, best in the area!!  The waitstaff and bartender were really nice, and the ambiance in the restaurant is nice.  The bar has two tv's, about 12-15 stools, and a few 2 seater tables.  The restaurant is separated from the bar by tall walls, but you can still see through to look at all the decorations or fish tank.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Stephanie J.

description:
I may be traveling to the real Koh Samui later this year, so thought it fitting to check out this restaurant.  I met a friend here for lunch today, and while it was empty (SOMA's pretty dead on the weekends), I did like the ambiance.

Serving sizes were generous (we both had leftovers) and prices were reasonable.

We started with spring rolls which were fresh, but other than that, a spring roll is a spring roll.

My friend ordered the BBQ Bangkok Grilled Chicken which looked good, but cannot vouch for.  I ordered the Koh Tao Noodles with Beef which was great, although a little heavy on the peanut sauce. 

We finished up with some mango sticky rice - the mango was fresh and it came with mango ice cream on top as well - a nice addition surprise!
author: Jim B.

description: Amazingly bad service, amazingly long wait for food. The restaurant was in a total free fall. No manager was available to help, even when I asked to talk to one. The staff had no clue how to address the problem. Extremely frustrating.
author: Jim M.

description: I love monkeys and I love Thai food, so I was ready to fall in love with this place when we came one Saturday for lunch. I was happy with the decor and the service, the food was pretty tasty, but I felt that the portions were just a little skimpy for the price.
author: Joel A.

description:
If you lived or worked around here..........definitely a 4 star. If you don't, like myself, then this is a 3 1/2 star restaurant. The food is average, the ambiance is nice, and the service was good. Overall..........it's just your typical Thai restaurant trying to be a little more eloquent by plating it nicely and having a full bar. The Cha'am of Thai food I say. 

We had the chicken basil, fried pad Thai noodles(this is something different and actually tasty), and pad seew. I heard the curry was good. I would come back to order the fried flat noodles again because it is so different and also the curry.
author: jason g.

description:
Like many others before me have said, get the Bags of Gold, Pumpkin Curry, and the Grilled Honey Duck. (kick ass, says G)
Saturday night 8:30pm, restaurant was packed busy, so we had to sit at a bar table and we still had great service.
Edging on pricey, we paid nearly $50 for the above and 2 small servings of rice. It's Thai food, isn't that supposed to be cheap? But I'm sure we'll be back when the time comes as it's really close to home.
author: Carnley P.

description:
Went for lunch today and was very disappointed. I have been there a couple of times in the past and never had an issue..

I ordered the "Monkey Quick Set" which comes with 3 fresh rolls and panang beef curry. The 3 fresh rolls were basically 1 regular fresh roll cut into 3 pcs! The beef curry was just gross (sorry, no other words to describe). It was all stringy and the sauce was gloopy and argh nasty! Also, 13$ for lunch is a bit on the high end, especially for thai food.
author: Seema M.

description:
I'll preface this blurb by admitting that I am NOT the biggest THAI food aficionado --- though I'm game when it comes to stumbling across AMAZING Thai cuisine.***

What is it with this place?  If it were not for the psuedo-pleasant company in tow, I would have ditched the dinner.  The chef should have been SHOT for serving dried up steak slivers as their sizzling sirloin dish.  We sweetly sent it back and they STILL could not get it the second time around.  It should NOT be that difficult to lightly sizzle your steak and slice it without having it reminiscent of cardboard.  A TRAVESTY, I tell you!!!  

The only  somewhat edible dish was the much touted pumpkin curry.  Then again, the chicken slices were ALSO overcooked.  Let me tell you.  As trendy as it's become, OSHA THAI serves a much TASTIER and more EDIBLE version.  

Thus, I will NOT be returning to this establishment.  NO matter HOW attentive the staff or adorable the owner's toddler is. Not even for the "tough-to-come-by" Sonoma Coast pinot noir my buddy raves about.  

***The BEST Thai food (outside of Thailand, since I have NOT had the pleasure of visiting there, yet) I've had the pleasure of sampling to date has been out of QUEENS, NY @ Sripraphai.
author: BrasilPo P.

description:
We came here for dinner tonight.  The experience overall was pleasant.
I had a lychee martini ( ok ) and mango martini ( good ) and seabass curry (very good). The hubby enjoyed a couple of chimays, the spring rolls and chicken pad thai.  We thought the overall food quality was good and would return.  
The service was fine.
author: Lizete S.

description: Mediocre food, water tastes odd, and adult drinks that taste like pine sol.
author: Dave L.

description:
Before I start, @Rebecca A., who goes out on Valentine's Day? Only idiots do if they are really hoping for a romantic dinner on that day. Get real here. 

Try their Squid ink noodles with pan seared scallops. The have great items on the menu. Dine with a bottle of Chenin Blanc which goes perfectly fine with Thai food. I do agree with other reviewers that it is a bit pricey.
author: Brock L.

description:
Eggplant tofu is spicy yum
Brown rice was ok
Tom kuh was good but too sweet
Mango sticky rice comes with mango sorbet. Interesting but not that well executed
author: Christopher L.

description:
We have been frequent guest at Koh Samui but hadn't been in a few months recently. I was looking forward to going back today but it was somewhat disappointing. 

When we entered the waiter asked "Just two?", which is not such a good start. Once we were seated the waitress was a bit curt, but oh well. They had mixed up the menu quite a bit, which I liked. 

We had the fresh spring roles, pretty good as usual. My wife had the clay pot sea bass. The sea bass was quite "hard", as if overcooked, and also smelled quite fishy. Not really fresh. Not a good choice. I had the mango beef, which was fine.

I had also ordered a 2nd drink, which never arrived but was on the bill later. The waitress was only removing it after some discussion.

The overall impression for us was that the place was slipping, in particular related to the service and the freshness of ingredients. What a pity. It was a nice place in our neighborhood.
author: Heiko L.

description: Food and cocktails were good, I've definitely had better Thai food but they had some interesting items that you don't find on a standard Thai menu (more fusion-y I guess). Service needed work though, they forgot a friends wine and the main courses took a really long time to come out despite the restaurant not being very busy at the time.
author: Ely L.

description:
We live near Koh Samui so we end up eating there whenever we need a Thai fix - which is fairly often.  The first time we went, our friend took us there and started out the evening by saying that he had been to Thailand and that this food was even better.  That's a pretty grand statement.  I have not been to Thailand so I can't say, but I will vouch that this food is really good.  We usually go for dinner, and I generally stick with my favorites - the tom kha gai soup (best I've ever had and very filling because they give you lots of chicken), the pumpkin curry (with tofu instead of chicken), coconut rice.  It's reliable and a very pleasant dining experience.

I did do takeout for lunch once and didn't find the cafeteria style grub line and food to be as good as dinner - but it's a great deal so I guess I can't complain.
author: B. Y.

description: This is mine and my husband's favorite Thai restaurant in SOMA. The food is fantastic! They will make sure my food is gluten-free, which is very necessary for me and accomodate accordingly. Even the manager substituted an appetizer at happy hour prices because the one that was available was not gluten-free. They have an AWESOME happy hour!
author: Brittany F.

description:
Beautiful. Delicious. Reasonably Priced.

The red curry (it comes in a pumpkin!) is one of the best Thai dishes I've ever tasted.  The Pad Thai is also very strong. 

Absinthe does not go with thai food (I learned this the hard way), but they have some good s**t in that department, too.
author: Emily P.

description: I got takeout here during their busy weekday lunch rush. Panang curry is my  Thai place standby and it was great. Service was not overtly friendly on the phone but once I got there they were helpful and it everything was ready within 15 minutes of calling it in. I'm eager to go back and try more options!
author: Lauren C.

description:
Thai is my new found favorite food.  

Went here because I pass this place EVERY single day to get on the bridge to go East Bay.  Every time I pass it, I say in my head "I have to try this place".

I found the perfect opportunity!!!  

Decided to have dinner w/a friend and thought yes...I can finally eat here.  Arrived at 5:45pm.  The place was empty.  The decor was very cute.  A lot of light.  The waitress was great.

I ordered to drink a Thai Kiss which was great!!! Since I'm not a big drinker I needed something sweet and boy it hit the spot.  Though I couldn't finish it because I'm not a drinker, I did enjoy it.  I decided if I was going to eat here, let me really try out the food so I ordered an app.  I ordered the prawns wrapped in crispy rice paper.  It was great!  The dipping sauce was a little spicy but it was suitable for me.  My friend chose the Tom Ka Gai which is a chicken and mushroom soup w/coconut milk.  He loved it.  For our entrees I had the Traditional Bangkock Pad Tai noodles w/Tofu. MMMM MMM MMM.  I wish I had some now.  My friend had the special of the day which was the Mignon over green beans w/brown rice.  

Overrall...I was a very happy camper :)

Total for night around $86.00 w/o tip.

I would sooooo go there again!

One thing to keep an eye out for is there is only street parking.  Be careful and make sure you have enough in the meter :)
author: Sandra S.

description: I've been here twice and I'm unimpressed. The first time I had the pad thai, which was only ok, and definitely not delicious enough to order a second time. The next time I went I had the beef mango which was fine and the koh tao noodle which was crazy disappointing. On the koh tao noodle the peanut sauce was really good, but nothing else (noodles, chicken, spinach) had any flavor at all. I threw half of it away. So, of the two noodle dishes I've tried I would not bother eating either of them again. I don't know about you, but I love noodles, so a thai place that doesn't have good noodles is not a thai place that I will frequent. Sad.
author: Steffany F.

description:
This place is right around the corner from where I work.  I would give one star to this place on my experience there on Wednesday, March 27th around 12:30 where I went there for lunch with 2 co-workers, but since the food is pretty good and the service is marginal, I decided to be fair and give them 2 stars.  

First off, let me preface this review: they are not friendly here.  Whether you get their take out or eat inside, they are all about efficiency, not making you feel welcome.  Life in the big city, I guess. Well, back to Wednesday: 

Showed up for lunch and, as usual, no eye contact, no smile, got seated and menus.  One minute later the server asks us for our order and we tell her we are not ready. WRONG ANSWER.  You must now wait 10 minutes before I will come back!  Just so happens, we only had 40 minutes before a meeting, so we started to get nervous.  Eventually she took our order with a scowl on her face, the drinks were brought, and they were wrong.  Back they went.  I finished my diet coke and it sat there...empty.. as the waitress walked past it again and again.  When the food was brought, I asked another server and she did refresh my drink.  The food was delicious as always.  

Then:

I look over to my right as one of the staff, an young Asian man, was making up another table. He dropped half the clean silverware onto the floor, picked it up, and continued to make up the table.  I continued to watch to see if he would get clean silverware.  NOPE.  The silverware that was on the floor ENDED UP ON THE TABLE for the next customer.  I waited to tell my server, but she didn't care.  No one cared.  Business as usual.  

You have been warned.  I hope this was an isolated case and not how they normally run their business.  But, our little lunch adventure has made its way around the office.  Many have second thoughts about eating there again.
author: Mike J.

description:
Overall: A 
I've been here two times and each time has been spectacular. It's my favorite Thai in the city. 

Food: A 
Don't miss the chicken pumpkin curry and the honey roasted duck. If I'm ever on death row, the chicken pumpkin curry would be my last meal. 

Decor: A 
Trendy. How can you not like happy Buddhas? 

Service: A 
I felt like I was at a friend's house. Raffy is a sweetheart. 

Value: A 
Feeling this good usually costs me a lot more money!
author: Roger H.

description: Booked a table for 3 for New year's eve. Was called day of the booking to confirm and told there was only a $60 price fixe menu. NO indication on the web site or Open Table or the email confirmation that this was our only option. We cancelled. Poor form.
author: Brian G.

description:
Food alone, KS&M would only get 2 stars. It gets one more b/c of the decor and service and the little cute plastic monkeys that hang off cocktails. Nice touch.

Food was slightly disappointing, or rather, it could have been better.
- Southern Curry ($13) with beef chunks in Panang red curry was served on a plate so that there wasn't much curry to ladle over rice and the beef was tough. Over cooked, so not tender. 
- Seabass Mor Din ($16) on the other hand was much better. Buttery sea bass was sauteed with vermicelli noodle, shitake mushroom, broccoli and carrots and served in a metal pot. Presentation and food were both done well.
- Spicy Eggplant Tofu ($9) offered rich flavor with fresh basil in chili and garlic sauce. Only comment here was that the portion could have been a little bigger. Both tofu and eggplant pieces were small. Left you craving for more.
- Unfortunately, rice here comes at a premium. We got 2 bowls of Brown Rice @ $3 each. A bit high if you ask me. Jasmine comes in at $2 per bowl. Ridiculous.

But the rich dark woods, golden buddha bronze art, staff dressed in Thai attire, all lend to the gentle ambiance of this more upscale Thai restaurant. They were very attentive, filled the water glasses several times, and were always polite.

Come here to savor the mood, and know that you sacrifice a little on the food.
author: Cindy W.

description: Best Thai food EVER.  I eat a lot of Thai food and this is wonderful!  It was really like gourmet Thai food.  The flavors were amazingly complex and the food was very rich without being too heavy.  I had the Mango beef and the Tom Ka soup and my gf had the seafood firecracker in yellow curry.  Just really really good.  The service was friendly and very efficient, without being bothersome.  I recommend this pace to anyone in SF!!
author: Ty M.

description:
So, obvi you MUST try the pumpkin curry, but here are some other favs to try:

* BAGS. OF. GOLD. 
* Fresh spring rolls  (best I've ever had, anywhere)
* Coconut rice

I'm a huge Thai / Vietnamese food lover. Up until I came here, my favorite restaurants for thai were House of Siam  and Krung Thai in San Jose. I still think they are great options in the South Bay, but I would gladly drive all the way to SF instead to eat at Koh Samui.

I came with a group of 10, and we decided to split a bunch of dishes. I literally loved every thing I tried. Great place to come w/ a group, especially during happy hour after a long day at work. 

Fun / Funky decor and a very positive vibe zipping through the place.
author: Kristen M.

description:
Last Thursday when we were trying to go to a bar near the stadium to catch a Giants game - this was the ONLY place that was almost empty. 

The bar has two TVs. One has Thai TV (I am assuming since it's a Thai restaurant) and the other had the Giants game. They would not change both TVs to show the National League Championship Series. The one TV that had the game, had such a LOW volume, you couldn't hear it. This is definitely not a first choice to catch a game --- it's not a sports bar. 

However, happy hour was from 4-7pm, EVERYDAY. There were 7 of us and we ate apps and had $2 beers for a total of $85! That was SUCH a great deal!!!! We would definitely go back for that alone!!!
