description:
I have been there twice and each time, no matter what we order, it is excellent.  Both times, we favored the green curry.  The shrimp dish was prepared the very best of any Thai food that I have had.  It is presented beautifully too.  The descriptions on the menu are quite good and the wait staff is happy to answer any questions.  
The ambiance is beautiful.  the late afternoon sun hitting the sculptures in the middle of the room is great and later, after dark, the buddas shine.
I enjoyed the light jazz music the first time we were there.  The rock music the second time made it a little hard to converse at the table.
I look forward to returning!  Enjoy!
author: L H.

description: I recently moved to San Francisco and Koh Samui and the Monkey was recommended to me by a friend who had lived here for a number of years (thank you Ji!). She called it one of the best Thai restaurants in the US and I definitely think it's the best I've had here in San Francisco. I have brought a number of friends here and the food and service is always great. My favorite dish is the pumpkin curry served in a pumpkin - while technically it may be a squash, it's delicious. I love it that they have brown rice, which has a great nutty flavor. I took a group last night and we had the corn fritters and chicken satay to start. The corn fritters are a must have, as is the pumpkin curry. We also sampled two deserts, the mango sticky rice was good and we all enjoyed the chocolate cake with coconut ice cream. Koh Samui and the Monkey is offiically on my list of recommended restaurants in my new city.
author: Vanessa F.

description: Man, this is one FANTASTIC Thai restaurant!(My partner and I LOVE Thai food and THAILAND!!!) This is yet another restaurant in our "hood" the atmosphere is nice, the waitstaff very attentive, the food incredible! I am a vegeterian(my partner is not, just at home ;) and the veggie options at this fine establishment are practically limitless!  and for you meat-eaters there are also endless choices! The restaurant is a bit LOUD, but these days what restuarant isn't?! Still I think they could benefit from having an acoustical engineer check it out (it might be worth it!) but that doesn't prevent us from getting take out(no they don't deliver you have to pick it up) That's all.
author: Len H.

description: This is a high class Thai restaurant (and by high class I mean high prices) in the SOMA district conveniently located halfway between my work and my home. Fortunately for me, we came here for a work related dinner so money was not an issue (thank you Jim!) The tables were decorated with tulips in water glasses. A well stocked bar is evident as you enter the restaurant. We started with some delicious appetizers- fried sweet corn fritters dipped in a cucumber chili sauce, fresh spring rolls served with peanut sauce, and a dish with spinach leaves filled with chicken, peanuts, and toasted coconut. For dinner we had an assortment of delicacies including pad thai, panang duck curry, lemon grass tofu, beef with fried mango, pumpkin curry served in a hallowed out kabocha squash and sizzling seafood stew. All was served with coconut rice. The pumpkin curry was my favorite, but perhaps I am biased since I a huge fan of pumpkin. The panang duck was also quite tasty. Desserts were a whole other ball of wax. Completely out of this world that is. Very creative. We had the following: fried and caramelized bananas flambe (ie they were on fire) served with toasted coconut and ice cream, mango sticky rice with mango sorbet, baked kabocha squash with pumpkin custard and pumpkin ice cream, and a jackfruit iced milk. I must say that again my favorite was the pumpkin dessert although all were quite spectacular. I should also mention the cocktails they serve are creative, although I was not too much of a fan of the one I ordered (something with pomegranite and gin).
author: Kate A.

description: service could be better...but decent thai food.  maybe i need to order better, but i wasn't satisfied with the bbq chicken.  portions are a bit on the smaller side -- esp for us americans used to hungry man portions.  good thai iced tea.  nice atmosphere.  please spread the tables out a bit more as i don't like being knocked by your skinny ass when you walk by every minute.  thanks.
author: Carol C.

description: i came here with some hesitation but tried to be open-minded. this food is just not for me though. i thought everything tasted bland and boring. i guess it can do the job if you're hungry and in the area though.
author: Michelle I.

description: came here for a birthday dinner with some friends. aside from the cute monkey icon on the menu and the sleek-western-but-with-asian themes decor and sexy lighting, i was not too impressed with the food itself (or the service). i really wanted to like this place, but we ordered family style and the portions were pretty small so in the end we were not completely satisfied. honestly i think we could have gone to osha thai a few blocks away and had more food of the same quality for the price. oh well!
author: Lori J.

description: Adding a star because I just splurged on their grilled steak w/ pineapple salad today. Damn-that thing is good!
author: C G.

description: They had some of the best soup I have ever had.  We also had the curry and pad thai which was fresh and tasty.  A little on the pricey side for lunch.  They didn't have a lunch menu, so you have to order family style.
author: Jennifer K.

description: really really good thai food in a nice open and simple space.  green beans with tofu, pad kee mau, giant scallops, duck, sea bass, bok choy, bbq chicken, papaya salad were all amazing. (yes i was really really hungry!)  service was a bit off, but the staff was friendly and the drinks (nigori cocktail) was just right.  i'll be back next time i'm near this part of town.
author: Haru K.

description: Best Thai restaurant in the city.  I live around the corner and am there or order take-out probably once every 10 days.  Go.
author: David S.

description: I really like this place. Sure, it's not cheap, but it's good and it's walking distance from my house and on my way home from work when I want some take out.  And their chicken coconut soup is really good.
author: M B.

description: We came here on a Friday in a party of 5. The service is a little slow here. Considering the look and feel of the place, I did expect better service. We basically had to seek out the service anytime we needed something. One big ding is my drink order. We had 2 orders of thai iced tea but only one arrived. After 15 minutes and my mouth getting quite dry, I asked about my drink. It was obvious they forgot my drink. So, the waiter came back and told me the reason I didn't get my drink was because they're of thai iced tea (at 830PM on a Friday nite). That was an impressive start. No apologies, just that they're out. So, we went ahead and ordered several of the popular dishes; duck, beef, and shrimp. The food was ok. Nothing special to rave about. The beef was very hard and the "spicy" dishes were not all that spicy. I like the atmosphere of the place, but for the food and price, I'd try other places first.
author: nik t.

description: its an average place for vegeterian food. stay away from the fried tofu dish unless they serve it with a straw - yea u heard me - the tofu was the medium hard kind and they had not strained the liquid so when we bit into our pieces we had the liquid from the bitten peice washing down any flavur of the tofu. maybe this is the 'monkey's' revenge on its customers. and why are all places adding '& the monkey' or something to their name. their noodle dish with the peanut suace - avoid - too peanuty and not enough noodles..decent hot oil and sauces...
author: jigi s.

description: Everything I've tried here has been delicious but it's a little pricey for lunch so even though I work nearby I don't eat here very often.
author: Zach S.

description: i like this place. the food was surprisingly good. i had the chicken pad thai. it wasn't dry and rubbery, but on the juicier side if that's possible for noodles. the papaya salad was flavorful. fish sauce wasn't overpowering like i've experienced at other thai places. the portions weren't huge, which i liked. i felt a bit underdressed for this place. it's more on the nice side, good for a date. i would definately go back again, esp. because i can walk here!
author: Charlene C.

description: Everytime I go here I fall back in love with the Mango Mojitos and the clay Sea Bass. The staff is very friendly and the location is perfect for a date or a fun night out with friends. Highly recommend this place.
author: R P.

description: Good semi-casual thai restaurant.  Parking is easy (plus!).  Food is reasonably priced.  Surprisingly decent wine list - how can you go wrong with Cakebread!  Good restaurant for a group (spacious) or a casual date (it's not too romantic).
author: kimberly t.

description: i'm not really big on thai....the chicken pad thai is hit or miss. we usually place orders here at work and by the time we get it the noodles are just a balled up blob of starch.  it's probably better if you eat there...but this is just my experience.
author: Craig I.

description: I really wanted to like this place but today I came to the conclusion that it's just not going to happen. I have tried a variety of dishes from the daily specials to various curries and have not been blown away by any of them. One of the first items I ordered was the ever popular pad thai and it was by far the worst pad thai I have ever had. I didn't realize you could screw up that dish but they found a way to make mess out of it. However, the curries are a big step up and I would recommend the pumpkin curry. Today I had the sweet chili chicken with crispy basil and while the flavors were fine the food was served lukewarm. It only took them about 5 minutes to serve my two friends and I so I'm guessing our meals were scooped out cafeteria style which surprises me because it doesn't strike me as that type of restaurant. The portions are also very small for the price. I paid $9 today for a small scoop of chicken and rice. For $9 I could take a quick bus ride up to the Thai restaurant in the food court at the Westfield Center and get three times as much food for the same quality or go to Osha for much higher quality. Also, my friend ordered a coke which came in a glass that I doubt could hold 12oz of soda. He finished it and asked the server for a refill... when the bill came we noticed that not only does Koh Samui charge you for soda refills but each soda costs $3 so he was rung up for $6 worth of soda! Now maybe it states this on the menu but who would have figured it would of cost that much? Bottom Line: Koh Samui has just joined the list of restaurants I will not be going back to.
author: Mark B.

description:
one of the best thai restaurants that i've been to. very diverse and interesting menu. lots of dishes to choose from. i don't eat rice (except for sushi), so it's hard to find a thai place for me with dishes other than rice ones. this place has a great variety of appetizers and a good selection of  salads and noodle soups. pumpkin curry is definitely a crowd favorite. 

i like the atmosphere a lot too and i've never had any problems with service. i mostly go here for lunch, but been here for dinner once as well. the price range is $6.95-$12.00 for lunch dishes and about $8 for appetizers. one dish i would stay away from is their pad thai. suprisingly, it was super bland and not worth the money.
author: Katya A.

description: Watch out for this place - they will rip you off on your credit card bill ... otherwise pretty mediocre thai food and poor customer service.
author: Christina V.

description: the pumpkin curry is great, but the prices are a little high. there's normally a short wait at lunchtime (is this place ever not packed?). be prepared to get a funny look if you accidentally call it spank the monkey.
author: Bee H.

description: Having tried numerous Thai restaurants in my current and past lives, I've would certainly say that I'm a curry fanatic. I also know good curry when it reaches my taste buds. KOh Samui & the Monkey falls in the above average category, at least in my book. The decor is a little quirky and over the top for a thai place...they kind of try to do a little of everything, but once you get past that, the place is nice. We went here for my birthday so it was a large group of people and although I don't have a clear recollection of all the occurrences that took place, I remember the food was quite tasty and the service was great. As always, I ordered a yellow curry and it was soooooo good!!! As for the rest of the food I picked at from plates (gotta love sharing!), it was also good. Although Koh is not your average neighborhood eatery with neighborhood prices, it definitely warrants a come-back visit.
author: Joey C.

description: I'm really sad to say that this place has really gone downhill.  My husband and I live nearby and this was our go-to place for a low-key Thai dinner when we didn't feel like cooking.  The last several times we've been there, however, the food has frankly sucked.  We ordered a papaya salad that came in this odd cylindrical wooden bowl, and unfortunately, it seemed that it had been sitting in that wooden bowl forever because it actually tasted like wood.  I think the salad just picked up the flavor of the wood bowl or the varnish because it tasted exactly how the wood bowl smelled.  Not so great.  My husband ALWAYS gets the pumpkin curry, but over the years it's become a watery mess with half-cooked pieces of pumpkin.  My green curry beef was okay, but really not worth the price considering the 4 or 5 slivers of beef in it.  I think we're going to have to find a new neighborhood Thai joint.
author: Michelle A.

description: okay, so they get 5 stars for picking a great name, and the whole place is elevated above the street level with lots of glass surrounding the dining room, so you get a birds eye view of brannon and ritch streets.  okay, thats an exaggeration, maybe you get a yao ming's eye view.  there is bar that looks like it should be packed on any week night, but was empty while we were there.  maybe it was the snow white they had playing on the bar tv.  whats up with that?  lastly, the food didnt impress.  flavors were good, but the preparation was lacking (chicken and pork were dry, beef felt like it had been coated in too much baking soda) and the pea shoots where old and tough.
author: Curtis Y.

description: I've been a long time regular customer of Citizen Thai and The Monkey (on Grant Ave at Vallejo St) but when they closed down I began dining at their sister restaurant - Koh Samui and the Monkey.  Every year I'd always throw a large dinner party at their restaurant.  This year, my husband (now) and I had our engagement party here and they were able to accomodate 32 people on a Thursday evening.  The menu is exceptional and really captures the authenticity of Thai cuisine!  Raffy the manager is awesome - he is very accomodating and very easy to talk to when it comes to customizing a pre fixe menu.  The staff is prompt and service is superb.  Dishes to die for:  Bag of gold minced chicken, shrimps wrapped in rice paper sacks; Prawns wrapped in crispy rice paper 8; Crying tiger salad grilled sirloin beef mixed with lime juice, Thai herbs, chili flakes and red onion; Crispy soft shell crab with garlic and pepper served with cucumber vinaigrette; Sea bass clay pot sautéed assorted sea bass with mixed vegetables (Sea Bass Mordin); Spicy sirloin beef with vegetables in green curry sauce.  Our guests loved the dishes and enjoyed every course.
author: Lyn D.

description: get the lunch special: duck curry over rice with a side of imperial rolls or chicken satay and a thai tea....yummy!
author: Cyn B.

description: i went here on my birthday and had a great time... the drinks were good and they came with little tiny plastic monkeys hanging off of them.. the atmosphere was good too... and the food was good... it's good for groups and overall had a good time!
author: Angeli J.

description: I've been here probably five times over the past three years. I've always been unexcited by the food.
author: Max D.

description: Yummy Thai, reasonably priced, good environment, will go back again for sure.
author: Weihan W.

description: mediocre. the food and the service are less than exceptional.  a lot of confusion with my order, and amongst employees.
author: Vanessa Z.

description: I love coming here. Great place for groups or a date! Koh Samui caters more to the american-thai palate, with creative twists on thai dishes. Their most popular dish by far is the pumpkin curry, which completely delivered on my expectations. Unique dish, great taste, interesting use of spices and beautiful presentation! (The curry is served in a hollowed out pumpkin). Seafood is also fresh. I had the garlic pepper prawns recently. Really enjoyed that dish - the spices used in the dish were well balanced. Pad thai is consistently good as well. One of the most interesting things I've had here is the fried sweet corn patties. I'd definitely recommend trying it if you're a big fan of corn bread or tamalito. Koh Samui is the place to go if you're looking for a good cocktail and a good meal with friends. Cocktails are very innovative. If you're looking to try something different, try the banana liqueur cocktail with a chili flake rim. Definitely not for the light at heart because the chili flakes pack a punch!
author: Jessica S.

description: I think places like Ana Mandara, Slanted Door,  and Betelnut (to name a few)have changed the face of Asian cuisine in updated, fashionable settings and Koh Samui has followed suit...The staff is dressed in the traditional Thai attire; the dusty,chipped ceramic dieties of good luck (you know, that friendly "Hello Kitty" cat throwing a high five) found in other Mom and Pop joints are presented here somewhat tastefully; and the bar is a comfy place to wait for your table...nicely done.  That said, the food here is far inferior to many of the Mom and Pop Thai joints here in the city.  Everything was soooo sweet and everything pretty much tasted the same.  And service was robotic:  the hostesses all prettied up in their Thai dresses could hardly crack a smile while our server seemed afraid to have any cadence in his voice... a nice setting only does not a good restaurant make.  Catchy name, though.
author: Jaena G.

description: the selection of food was fairly good, but like others, i wouldn't make a special trip back to this place.  it was crowded on a sunday night and the ambient noise was way too much.  the setting is industrial SOMA, but there aren't any thick curtains or anything else to absorb the noise of other diners.  made it difficult to talk to the three others at the table.  serivce was prompt without any real passion.  the duck was decent, the pea shoots were tasty, the spicy garlic shrimp were really good, and the pumpkin curry was a nice surprise.
author: shawn g.

description: i have never really had bad phad see ew, but this ALMOST was the first bad experience i have had. the noodles were pretty much tasteless. also the noodles weren't even cut. they were so lazy that they decided to just place big blankets of noodles into my to go tupperware. the only good thing about this place is that it's close to my work, so what i would recommend to all of you is to not eat here. maybe the ambiance of the restaurant is nice?
author: Katherine F.

description: I like this place- I like how the servers wear beautiful Thai dresses. The food was pretty good too. I tried the testing platter which included a combinations of spring rolls, chicken satay and other stuff- it was just OK for me. The pad Thai noodle wasn't as saucy as I am use to but still not bad.
author: Mi P.

description: i personally love this place.. it's one of my favorite thai restaurants in the city.. very warm and open feeling.. with good food.. great for your small dates or your medium size parties..
author: Timothy W.

description:
so i work near here and we very rarely go to lunch here. it's the only thai in the area and one of the few non-super-gross places in the area. safeway and subway are both gross. 

the food is unfortunately nothing to rave about. it's not bad and is a pretty good deal with the lunch specials. 

the service is pretty quick and they're as friendly as any thai restaurant in the city- so not really at all.

i was kind of disappointed that this place is so meh since i had a great meal at citizen thai in north beach, which is owned by the same people.
author: Saikat P.

description: I've been here a few times and the food has always been really good.  The decor and atmosphere are nice too.  Although, I went last night and the hostess told us to sit at the bar for a few minutes when we got there, even though there were many open tables.  She then forgot about us and we had to ask to be seated again.  Sadly, the waitress was not much better.  Our appetizers and main course where served before a glass of water could be poured.  If the place was actually really busy I would have been more forgiving about the level of service.
author: Sharon G.

description: I really enjoyed my meal. Delish soup. Good pumpkin curry and some of the best pad thai that I've had (long noodle pad thai). I'm a fan!
author: Sima S.

description: Great dishes.  I'm partial to the Jatujak Pad See Ew.  Also great for group lunches.
author: Mike R.

description: Basil chicken over rice. This plate is so good, its the only reason I keep coming back here. But the downside is that the portions are way too small for the price. The Thai noodles arent that bad either.
author: Sleep E.

description: I like this place.  I've brought several of my friends/family here. The Thai food is slightly more upscale than most.  Price isn't much more than others.   If you are in the area I would recommend this place for thai food.  No five star because I probably have a prejudice for the food I had at my first thai place (not in CA where pad thai was spicy :)  ).  Food is good.
author: Brian S.

description: Nice place, good food.  I love the place settings and it's intimate even for a large space.  Reading the bathroom walls is always fun!
author: Misti L.

description:
got here a bit late for happy hour but still enjoyed. especially my bearded bartender, rreeeearrr! 

oh right, back to the food. 

it was yummy. drinks are a bit frou frou but a good restaurant to meet up with long lost friends.
author: Eliza K.

description: i was impressed w/ this place during my first visit.  nice space, nice atmosphere, nice waitstaff, etc., but i become less happy the more i return to eat here.  our party of 4 ordered 4 different dishes to share and i didn't really like any of them.  i ordered the salmon.  how can you mess up salmon?  i didn't expect it to look and taste like it was deep fried.  it was hard and dry.  the chicken curry had too much cartilage still stuck on it and the pad thai was bland.  perhaps the regular cooks took the day off.  i'm off to explore better thai spots in the city.
author: Immer E.

description: great food and service...i absolutely loved the sea bass....one of the best Thai foods i've ever had...Green curry is pretty good too..if you've never been there you should put it on your list..
author: Mahyar K.

description: Two words--PUMPKIN CURRY.  Most Thai places only serve pumpkin curry seasonally.  Koh Samui not only has it ALL the time....but they serve it in an actual pumpkin!!! If you live in the neighborhood, this place far surpasses all the other thai places.  Great service, low key but nice atmosphere, and I haven't order a bad thing there yet.  For an appetizer, get the corn fritters--yummy fried goodness!
author: Deepta B.

description: This place is lame in many ways - mediocre overpriced food, absolutely terrible service, and so loud you can hardly hear what anyone is saying. The food was attractively presented and the $10 drinks were good, but these are the only good things about this place. The food was extremely overpriced for the small quantity provided. The servers rarely came by to fill up the water, so half the table was out for much of the meal. I asked for peppers when ordering, then had to ask 3 more times before being given an empty container where they used to be then had to ask twice more to actually get some. Our dessert never arrived. I would definitely never go back.
author: k r.

description: Me and my roommates came here for happy hour on  Friday afternoo and had a great time! The service was really fast and the servers were really friendly. He actually gave us a free round of spring rolls because he said he was sorry he was slow with the drinks (which actually came within five minutes).  We ordered spring rolls and the corn cakes, which were amazing. The drinks were pretty good as well. We actually came here a few nights ago for dinner and the tofu was pretty good, but the pad thai was average. All in all, service was really friendly and food was pretty good! :0
author: Suhasini C.

description: The Beef+Mango rocks here!  Nice restaurant, great service, great food.
author: Carl M.

description: great drinks, cool atmosphere, hot bartender, great mango salad and mushroom appetizer, nice waiter, pretty inexpensive pricing, we will be going back
author: s b.

description: This place was great.  Everyone enjoyed their drinks and the food was delicious.  We had a big table and shared the dishes and they were all great.  Nice ambience, too.
author: Mason C.

description: We recently moved down the block and we've enjoyed our experience here.  The ambience is a step above the average Thai place, and the food good and not run of the mill.  The Mieng Kum is a fun starter and the pumpkin curry was a great blend of flavors.  If you like aggressively spiced food, this is probably not the Thai place for you.  The service is always good and the prices reasonable for the level of the restaurant.
author: Greg K.

description: yummy curry ....feel like home
author: Elsa K.

description:
this place makes me miss thai pepper and amarin thai in the south bay. the food at those restaurants is better and cheaper, despite both being chains.

i live nearby, so i eat here pretty regularly despite being slightly cranky about having thai places i prefer more.  the basic three curries are tasty, although they regularly overcook the chicken and beef. lunch and dinner meals are a bit overpriced, and the more i eat here the more i think they are basically americanizing all their dishes - ie, i think they're usually tasty, but there's nothing particularly special, extra tasty, or authentic about it. 

service is unremarkable in that it is prompt and attentive but very impersonal.  i find myself more often thinking that the place, due to all the windows and direction it faces, has great light for portrait photography than i do about the food.

three stars because it's just about average.
author: m l.

description: By far my favorite Thai restaurant in the city!  I always bring friends and family to Koh Samui and the Monkey when they visit San Francisco.  The food is absolutely amazing, and even friends who have spent time in Thailand say it's the closest to real Thai food they've had in the US.  Nice ambiance and all around great dinning experience!
author: Kimberly K.

description:
the decor is great and the service is so-so (could not get our waiter, or anyone else's attention to get more rice and more drinks), but i liked the food.  we ordered: steak salad; duck curry; pad thai; spicy green beans; and the pot of gold (i think that's what it's called) appetizer.  steak salad was yummy and duck curry was not too curry-ish.  pad thai was alright, but spicy green beans were great.  my bf asked for extra spicy, which they did not deliver at all.

i also tried a random drink on the menu, which was okay.  the menu is modern thai food and a little limited, in my opinion....but i will go back and i think that once i figure out my faves on the menu, it will be a great spot.
author: courtney o.

description: About once a year I find a place that yammer on about anytime anybody mentions eating in San Francisco and Koh Samui & The Monkey is, without doubt, my 2008 pick.  The food is delicious and the perfect level of spicy requested on each dish (just shy of breaking a sweat for me and just above ketchup for my wife), the service is fast and nice and the cocktails are innovative and fantastic (we always end up drunker than we planned because it sounds, and is, so good).
author: Mike B.

description:
wow, i've read the reviews and i don't get it. i love this place!!

the food is great, always fresh, and seems well above the average. the place is really beautiful, clean, and the service was pretty much always great.

it does get really loud though on busy nights, hence only 4 stars.
author: Prem M.

description: Best Pad See Ew ever.... beats the heck out of Osha's at Embarcadero!
author: Vincent C.

description: I have had great experiences here - best yellow curry and peanut sauce in town.  One bad experience recently drops the star level.  The new hostess seriously screwed up our take-out order.  I am not exaggerating - it took over ONE HOUR to get our food - even though they initally promised 15 minutes.  We kept saying that we had to go b/c the other people in our party were performing at the Hemlock and she kept saying "5 more minutes". To say that the band barely made their performance on time is an understatement.  Of course, when we left AFTER WAITING ONE HOUR our orders were wrong anyway - including a veggie dish that ended up with chicken in it.
author: d l.

description: we got their earlier than the rest of our party and they graciously told us that they would hold the table for us and we don't have to worry.  that rubbed us the right way and we thought we were ready for a great thai meal.  we sat at the bar while we waited and noticed how both modern and traditional the decor is.  we ordered the sweet corn fritters while waiting along w/ a lemongrass gimlet and bankok punch both of which were decent though i felt the gimlet didn't have enough lemongrass flavor.  the fritters tasted really good especially w/ the sauce that came with it.  once the rest of our crew arrived, we sat and got some more sweet corn fritters along w/ some crispy tofu cakes.  the tofu cakes were nothing special since there's nothing you can do w/ tofu cakes really.  for the main course, we all split red curry tofu, red curry chicken, ginger chicken, chicken in peanut sauce, spicy tofu, lemongrass tofu and pad see ew.  overall a decent meal but nothing to write home about.  the drinks were interesting as a good amount of us got the "Shock the Monkey" cocktail which was along the lines of a cosmo but not as girlie.
author: Swarup B.

description: I came here on my lunch break with a friend, and we were slightly intimidated about prices once we walked in to see such hip looking Thai restaurant. Asian Fusion interiors will never cease to intimidate me. Hip decor aside, the food was just okay, but at least the lunch menu was affordable and comparable to other Thai places. We ordered the panang curry with chicken and their Bangkok pad thai with beef. The beef was a bit  over cooked in the pad thai, and a bit too chewy. The panang curry was really good though. Totally reminded me of the Burmese fish noodle dish, oh no kauswe. It had that same coconut-y milky taste and consistency. I swear could just slather that all over my rice and be happy with just eating curry sauce and rice. It's a nice comfort food feeling. Service was great with very attentive servers. My glass of water was never really empty, so I can't complain about not being hydrated.
author: amy y.

description: 4 of us arrived at peak time on a gorgeous Friday night. within minutes or less we were seated in the middle of a HOPPIN' dining room. the lemon grass gimlet was fabulous. we had plenty of visiblity to the phenom food being served around us. lots of creative dishes, lots of more tame tourist type Thai standards. the sesame crusted sea scallops were delectable. they were out of brown rice but hey ididn't miss it as the jasmine was SOOO good. not a detail was overlooked- from the tea pots to the elephant encrusted plates but my absolute fave- the signs on the restrooms with icons of men and women in the universal position of the pee-pee dance. likely would get 5 stars on a night not soo busy but that said the staff, service and food were outstanding despite the crowd.
author: Kriz B.

description: this place is fun. i went with a bunch of friends and everything we had was great. it is definitely one of the better thai resturants i've been to in san francisco. the ambience is upbeat and modern and it's just a cool experience to check out new spaces like this one in soma.
author: joseph j.

description: I really love this place so it sucks that I have to write this review and give it only three stars.  The food is good and the service I get at the restaurant is not bad.  That said, you can imagine how excited I was when I learned that they were offering delivery service.  I ordered lunch for my staff the very next day and bragged about how great this restaurant is.  An hour after ordering, my assistant pointed out that our food still hadn't arrived.  Okay, that was strange.  Perhaps they are just backed up, I thought to myself.  We called the restaurant and the host confirmed our address and assured us our food was on the way.  Thirty more minutes later and still no food had arrived.  We called back a second time and were told the restaurant would call the driver.  No return call.  Needless to say, we never received our food despite two calls to the restaurant.  The following day I called and asked to speak to a manager.  I was put in touch with a woman named Zoe who not-so-politely told me that they had "issues" yesterday and that she was told by her staff that the driver couldn't find my building.  Uh, what do you mean couldn't find?  There's just three-foot high numbers in front of my building showing the building's address!?!  WTH!  Zoe could care less than I looked like a complete ass or that my staff ended up not having lunch because of their error.  She non-chalantly said that she was "sorry" (yeah, right!) and basically blamed the non-delivery on us because supposedly they called me back and there was no answer.  Hello...I'm in a building with a 24-hour doorman!  Whatever!  I highly DO NOT recommend ordering for delivery.  I won't knock the in-house service though--which is why I'm rating this restaurant one star!
author: Keilani L.

description: if you like having your dish bypass you and cool-off somewhere for 15 minutes, then this place is for you! oh, and if you also like not getting your exact change back, then by all means, check this place out!
author: Razmig M.

description: one of the best thai restaurants in san francisco...and it is the only place that i have been to that has crying tiger...the staff here is exceptional and they do their job with ease and finesse...great pace for lunch if you can get in...they get busy with the weekday work crowd...thats the only problem i have
author: Ron S.
